review.title: Great price, poor room and service
review.reviewText: The room did not include a mini-fridge, and most of it appeared as though it was still 1988.  It looks like the hotel had updated some of the other rooms, but not this one.  I needed to use the washer / dryer, and after 5 minutes of searching for it (front desk, maids office, etc) I was finally told by a maintenance employee that the washer / dryer "did not work."  So much for doing laundry after a week on the road...  I had tickets to a concert that needed to be printed out.  My buddy took care of calling the front desk, sending them the email, and walking up there to have it printed out.  The staff person had serious printer trouble (needed new toner cartridge, etc) and after three or four attempts, finally got a clean printout (so bar codes were legible and could be scanned).  Then the staff person told my buddy "maybe next time we not do this for you;" to which my buddy replied "maybe next time we not stay here."  I will say that housekeeping did a good job of cleaning the room each day that we were there, and the location was pretty good for SF.  I would definitely think twice before choosing to stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: Most everything.
review.locationRemarks: location was pretty good for SF

review.title: Run-down. Motel close to San Francisco Internation
review.reviewText: Booked a one nite stay through Expedia.  Requested a non-smoking room.  That's what it said on our room door,but when we entered it was so reeking with nicotine and smoke it was sickening.  The rug was stained and filthy.  The room furniture was very old.  The walls needed painting and some paint was peeling off.  When we went to bed the blanket on the bed had been turned sideways to fit across the queen bed.  It only came to the middle of our bodies. It was obviously a double size blanket trying to fit sideways on a queen bed.  No other blanket in the room.  This is a very shabby motel.  I would not recommend it to anyone.  When we asked for a refund of the room fee we were told no because we had booked it through Expedia.
review.negativeRemarks: This motel needs to be totally renovated and updated.  The grounds were a mess, the rooms are  shabby.

The underside of the bedspread was stained red, and should NOT have been on the bed.  The walkway to the room, a long corridor, was badly soiled and in need of steam cleaning.  Our reservation was for two days; we checked out after one.  Terribly run facility.

review.title: A little resort in South San Francisco
review.reviewText: In the middle of SFO's northern "Hotel Alley" sits this little bucolic gem, whose grounds are as meticulously kept as its buildings. The breakfast is very good, and the accessibility to SFO and the city is unbeatable. Eschew the hotel chains around it for a nice little escape from an otherwise industrial area!

review.title: Good for a stopover
review.reviewText: This was a perfect stopover for a very early flight. The shuttle was very reliable and quick. We would have liked the option of a packed breakfast but this wasn't available. The common facilities and breakfast / dining area looked very nice but we didn't have time to sample them.

review.title: Hotel was close to airport, but not spectacular
review.reviewText: The hotel was very old and did not have any great amenities. The room I was checked into, the key card did not work and they told me the battery was dead. They also told me they did not have any other room available. After several back and forth arguments, they gave me a room closer to the reception. All the lights in the room did not work, so it was pretty dark in there.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel was close to the airport, and offers a free shuttle to and from airport every half an hour.
review.negativeRemarks: Better breakfast, better interiors, and proper functioning of lights and key card switches.
review.locationRemarks: There is nothing close by. The airport is close to the hotel, but downtown SF is a forty minute cab ride.

review.title: Nice, reasonable hotel located 6 minutes from SFO
review.reviewText: Spent two nights at this hotel, one after arriving in San Francisco and another night before our flight out of San Francisco.  Rooms are comfortable enough.  Rooms that haven't been renovated very old and dated.  On the second night, we convinced the front desk clerk to give us one of the renovated rooms.  There was an extra charge to have the renovated room and I suppose it was worth it, however, the room faced the back parking lot which wasn't very nice.  The room we had on the first night faced the courtyard which was lovely.  We would stay here again.  The shuttle was very convenient.
review.positiveRemarks: What we liked was the proximity to the airport in San Francisco and the shuttle to/from the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: What could be improved is that they stop renting out the not yet renovated rooms and put guests into the newly renovated rooms.
review.locationRemarks: The location was minutes away from the San Francisco airport.  Costco was close by.

review.title: Hotel with Convenient Location
review.reviewText: I was mainly pleased with this hotel because it is literally across the parking lot from where I needed to be the following morning.  The lobby was extremely impressive, clean, and spacious.  The room itself was not as impressive, but very good considering the price.  I felt that it was on the small side.  Bathroom was about average, but clean.  The sink had a quality look to it.  I had some problems finding plugs, but there were some extension cords placed in convenient places, so I appreciated that thought.   Overall, this hotel was very impressive.  The continental breakfast was somewhat disappointing, although this was partly due to the lack of time I had to spend there.  It was spacious and the dining tables plenty.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenient location, lobby, minor details in arrangement in the room
review.negativeRemarks: Continental breakfast food offerings
review.locationRemarks: This is really convenient if you have to do something at the South San Francisco Conference Center the next morning!

review.reviewText: My ID card was lost at Immigration on arrival to SFO.  Needed to go often to the airport for that reason.  The distance between hotel and airport is close and convenient.   The driver of the shuttle bus was pleasant.

review.title: Well priced, close to airport, value for money
review.reviewText: The rooms were well priced.  The interior garden area was nice.  Breakfast was included and was comprised to toaster waffles, boiled eggs, cereal, juice, and toast.  They have an airport shuttle which you can use to get to the BART (subway) station and back and forth.  Note:  Using the BART from the airport is about $10/person more expensive round trip than using any other BART station.  The restaurant (buffet) is the best value for money anywhere in the area.  The food was good and there was a good selection.  There is seafood (crab legs, sashimi) and a number of other items on for supper.  I would recommend the restaurant.  Lunch doesn't close to 3pm either. Staff were friendly.  Rooms were basic.  I had to mini fridge or microwave.  I would stay here again.

review.title: Third Party Payment Issues
review.reviewText:
I recently stayed at this hotel, and while the staff were super friendly, and helpful, there was one big problem: Check in. I did a late check in, because the website said that I wouldn't be penalized if I did so, but the process to check in was such a pain. It was to my understanding that the hotel had changed its payment company, and it was not yet compatible with Expedia. What should have been a 5 minute check in, turned into a process that took over one hour. 

Other than that minor glitch, the hotel was in great condition, and very clean.

review.title: Best place if traveling to San Francisco
review.reviewText: I think this is the best place to stay if you're flying into SF. It's cheaper than hotels in San Francisco and San Mateo and as long as you stay on the peninsula and SF you don't have to cross a bridge a pay the toll to come back across. I just booked for another stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Not much. Too bad the gas station is right across from it. Makes it difficult to get to.

review.title: Close to the airport with shuttle service.
review.reviewText: Convenient shuttle service from hotel to airport. Room was ok.  Upholstered furniture was not clean.  Staff was polite.  Breakfast was ok. Just stayed one night before flying out early the next morning.

review.title: Visit this hotel soon, before it gets dynamited
review.reviewText: The photos would make you believe this is a modern, eco-resort. In fact it is a 1950's style motel with crumbling concrete outside corridors. You know, the kind of place that the cops use to hide someone in the witness protection program or where the detective show directors will stage a shooting or a drugs bust. There is some greenery but the "garden" is a bit of a stretch.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything would be improved by demolishing the establishment and replacing it with something that is competitive in the current market for hotels.
review.locationRemarks: The bar/restaurant at the adjacent Holiday Inn was OK and looked a better bet than the on-site Chinese restaurant.

review.title: Nice and not so nice.
review.reviewText: All staff we encountered were helpful and polite. The lobby is very nice. The yard within the hotel's buildings was a lovely welcoming space and we would have enjoyed the outdoor pool in nicer weather. The whole outside area would have been lovely to use in warmer, dry weather. Parts of the building were run down - looking worn and dirty on the outsides of doors and the exterior walls. The inside walls around the door and the door itself need a good scrub-down and perhaps a fresh coat of paint. The furniture was attractive but worn. The armchair was badly stained so we didn't feel comfortable using it. There were some missing and burnt-out light bulbs but we did have adequate light. The bathrooms were clean and the toiletries were nicely displayed. The breakfast was fine but we didn't like that the peanut butter and Nutella were in large jars (family style) rather than individually wrapped portions. With the nice outdoor space, the nice staff, the clean bathrooms and the price being the same, we would stay there again. Hopefully they will improve on the other things that fell short of good.
review.negativeRemarks: see above
review.locationRemarks: Close to SFO for the convenience of getting there for an early AM flight. Easy shuttle to SFO and then BART into San Francisco.

If not for only a one night stay and few options I would have left then.

review.title: Motel near the airport
review.reviewText: Didn't realize the doors to the rooms all opened to the outside.  The motel was on a busy road, near the highway.  There was graffiti on the door frame to the room.  Young kids seemed to be having fun at the pool, but they were a bit loud.  The only time I saw staff was at the front desk. We turned in our rental car the night before our flight and waited a long time for the shuttle to bring us to the motel.  It wasn't clear at the airport how to get to the shuttle to the motel.  It was a convenient location and a reasonable price for San Fran, but next time I would rather pay more for something nicer.

review.title: Service beyond my expectation
review.reviewText: My wife and I arrived at the hotel around 9am, due to our flight arrival time. Our intention were merely to check-in our luggage and then return in the afternoon. However, the front counter staff was very helpful and manage to get a room for us. In additions, we were also offer the breakfast service. The staff at the breakfast area were very helpful and friendly too. We were very impress with the services, although the hotel's design may not seems as new as those few around, and we would definitely go back again when visiting San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: Probably have some budget to upgrade the image.
review.locationRemarks: 5 mins drive from Airport and 5 -10 mins away from nearby small town where you find many good food and other facilities.

I would go back here, with the money I saved on booking it's an easy choice.  Uber or lift is an great option for $15 in and out of the heart of the city.

review.title: Sleep in the airport instead of this place.
review.reviewText:
Not a "hotel" -- a very old motel which has never been updated. Three stars - a joke!
Stayed 9/15/15 one night. Woman solo-asked for safe room. Was placed in room at extreme far end w entrance facing dark parking lot on edge of deserted field. Sheets seemed clean but threadbare. Blanket very old and worn. Creepy bedspread. Laid towels on top of sheet & pillowcase and slept fully dressed using my robe and raincoat as covers. Very loud group next door-noisy until I turned on my tv with volume up for about 10 minutes well after midnight. Quiet after that. Checked out at 5:14 am even though flight wasn't till about 10. With tax $200 plus. Big meeting in San Fran had good, reasonable places full. Worst motel experience of my entire 71 years.
review.positiveRemarks: Leaving early on free shuttle to airport.
review.negativeRemarks: See above.
review.locationRemarks: Near airport.

review.title: Worst experience
review.reviewText: This is the worst hotel I ever experienced in US!

review.title: Good valve great location
review.reviewText: Hertz drop off is within walking distance. Shuttle to airport was on time.Breakfast was good. You can tell that this is a heaavly used hotel because of its great value. The carpets were a little worn and dirty because of this. Resturants are within walking distance after dropping off car. Would stay here again to save $150 over others in the area.
review.negativeRemarks: cleancarpets

review.reviewText: Will not stay here again. And I shouldn't have to say more. Why do you make me write a long review? Is this enough words?
review.negativeRemarks: Everything.

review.title: enjoyed the stay
review.reviewText: Reservation easy...staff friendly...room comfortable and clean...great price for value...great location to SFO Airport. Great stay.

review.title: Close to the airport but dated
review.reviewText:
It is close to the airport and the shuttle service is very convenient but the hotel is old and the breakfast is very limited. I didn't feel we get enough value for our money. 
The room looked ok, but I hurt my finger walking on the dirty carpet, the shower clogged and I found a bug on the blankets.
The night shift shuttle driver demanded his tip and I only have $20 dollar bills, we asked for changed and he gave us less change than we asked for twice.
review.negativeRemarks:
Finish the renovation asap.
More options for breakfast.
Better pay for the shuttle drivers so they don't have to ask for tips like that.
review.locationRemarks: 7 minute ride to the airport. Nothing to do nearby.

review.title: Just OK
review.reviewText:
Several things stood out to us about our stay:
The staff:  They were outstanding, friendly, professional...  Just Great!
Free Breakfast:  Was good, nice variety, big room with plenty of clean seating and good food, but I wish there was a protein source available
The Room: Was comfortable, but way out dated.  I mean it is old stuff.  However it was clean.  And - they are updating the hotel so eventually all of the rooms will be new...
review.positiveRemarks: The staff, easy location, nice courtyard and pool.
review.negativeRemarks: The room was very old and outdated.  It was clean and comfortable.  Rooms are being updated - we just got an old one...
review.locationRemarks: It's close to San Jose and San Francisco.  Everything is close!

review.title: Nice place near airport. Tammy free breakfast
review.reviewText: Neat an d comfotable. Friend staff service, may smell the ocean wind

review.title: Older hotel undergoing renovations
review.reviewText: The rooms were nice, especially the rooms that faced the garden. The breakfast buffet was good and choices plentiful,

review.title: Good price
review.reviewText: Convenient and affordable rate but the room is very simple.

review.title: Scalding shower water
review.reviewText: The water for first shower was on the verge of being too hot. It couldn't be adjusted. Second persons shower was scalding hot.  Desk staff was extremely rude & refused to give refund for the nights stay. We had plane to catch & no time to wait for maintenance.
review.negativeRemarks: Shower water temp & desk staff.
review.locationRemarks: Close to San Francisco airport & the Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Good shuttle service to the BART
review.reviewText: Very cheap owners....you have pay $10/day extra for a fridge or microwave

review.title: Great. Overnight
review.reviewText: This was a last minute choice i had an 11hour lay over in san Francisco and was glad i stayed here, the staff was great and very helpful. The free breakfast and free shuttle bus to and from the hotel.  .big plus very close to the airport

review.title: Nice hotel ,V.good price Clean free car park
review.reviewText: I enjoyed staying the three nights their. i used my private cars since you have good parking place, i also enjoyed the breakfast and the nice big room with good furniture. it is close to every where max. 10 mils with no traffic problems.
review.positiveRemarks: large and clean room , Free parking and good breakfast, I enjoy my stay for three nights and the staff are friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: mini bar in each room

review.title: Nice overnight stop before heading to the Airport
review.reviewText: Clean room, quiet. Buffet was good but Hulohan's is a minute walk for an better dining expierence.
review.negativeRemarks: None.

review.title: Perfect stay for an over-night.
review.reviewText: Hotel rooms are a  bit "old" and need to be up-graded. But, the upgrading of rooms has begun.
review.positiveRemarks: Its very close by to the SFO Intl Airport.
review.negativeRemarks: the rooms.
review.locationRemarks: SFO Intl Airport.

review.title: not good
review.reviewText: Hairs in bathroom, sticky surfaces, heater didn't work. The beds seemed clean though. For  $180. I expect more. No coffee in room. Pretty nasty all in all.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness, coffee in room, nicer bedding. Mattress upgrade is long over due.
review.locationRemarks: You can see and hear planes. Very loud. Not a lot right near by.

review.title: Good stay.
review.reviewText: Only hotel on Expedia that was in our price range. Didn't care for the hotel being beside an airport but it was only for one night.

review.title: Decent accommodations close to major highway
review.reviewText: I booked a stay at a two-star hotel in the area without knowing which hotel I was going to be assigned. Luckily, it turned out to be a good overall experience.
review.positiveRemarks:
- Clean room and bathroom
- Daily breakfast buffet included with room charge
- Plentiful parking
review.negativeRemarks:
- Improve selection of entrees in breakfast buffet
- Provide more towels, bedsheets, and pillows for room guests
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is conveniently located close to the airport and off highway 101 which eases access to both downtown San Francisco and Silicon Valley.

review.title: Close to the airport, and shuttle was great.
review.reviewText: We arrived at the airport and the shuttle picked us up promptly.  The next morning we had a very early flight and the shuttle runs early.
review.negativeRemarks: The furniture in our room was very "tired" but everything was clean.  The bathroom had been renovated and was nice.
review.locationRemarks: Houlihan's is in the Holiday Inn two doors down, so a quick dinner was available.

review.title: Very close to the car rental return
review.reviewText: Hotel is undergoing renos and may be quite nice. Not bad and the price was right. The Chinese Buffett was awesome.

review.title: Only thing disappointing was breakfast selection.
review.reviewText: Thanks to Mat who helped check us in and printed directions for us to all the attractions.  He went above and beyond.

review.title: Close to airport but limited shuttle service
review.reviewText:
Chose this hotel due to shuttle service to airport (had an early morning flight). But the shuttle operates from 4.15am - 11pm. ( not 24hrs). 
Ended up taking cab to the airport so the purpose of booking this hotel was defeated.
Room is ok (old). "Ok" for staying overnight to catch flights at odd timings.

review.title: Very happy...
review.reviewText: A lot of customer reviews were negative but I took my changes and I loved the place. Staff is friendly and helpful. continental breakfast was good and there are no bed bugs. Very happy to stayed there and I will do it again.

review.title: Motel from 70's
review.reviewText: It's a very old motel from 70's with no renovation! Avoid if you can

review.title: Last resort If you are brave
review.reviewText: Did not really have a choice for my timeframe and budget but the front desk staff was very nice. The facility however was very old, very uncomfortable, smelled and even if you blanketed it in Lysol it probably still feel unsanitary. The bed is hard as a rock and all that was missing outside were a few hookers and drug dealers. Not a wink of sleep.

review.title: Surprising airport hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel lobby is quite nice, with wonderful staff. The rooms are old, but for someone who stays in hotels a lot, I rather enjoyed the furnishings for their more comfortable, old-fashioned feel. Everything was very clean. For the money, I would have liked a coffee maker and a fridge in the room. That said, they were very prompt at bringing a refrigerator even given my rather late check-in time, and in the morning they offer a free breakfast, so my coffee needs were met after all! If I'd had a little more time, I would have enjoyed my coffee in the nice courtyard garden. Free hotel - airport transportation. FYI - no elevator to the 2nd floor rooms. Thank you!
review.positiveRemarks: Lobby with fireplace; garden; staff; prompt refrigerator delivery to my room; free breakfast; and the staying-in-grandma's-guest-room feel!
review.negativeRemarks: Fridge and coffee maker in room?
review.locationRemarks: N/A

review.title: mediocre hotel
review.reviewText: Room had no waste basket, cable TV had minimum sports channels. Only restaurant is a prepriced Chinese buffet and no bar on prem. Had to go to Hooihans for drinks,food and sports tv. Shower head falling apart. free internet a lot of URL's were blocked by my security suite that has never happened before at other hotels and hot spots. Coninental breakfast was okay however.No room coffee maker.
review.negativeRemarks: TV channels, room amenities and a real restaurant and bar service
review.locationRemarks: typical airport location, Not far from San Francisco and all those attractions.

review.reviewText: the people at check in and check out were so nice and even offered to help with heavy bag.  the room was very clean though carpet was tired.  Beds were comfortable. there is an Asian buffet next to the hotel that was very good!
review.positiveRemarks: there was free breakfast though we had to leave for the airport before it opened.  there also was a shuttle to the airport that cinched my choice.

review.title: Near Airport
review.reviewText: Location close to the airport, with most of the necessary amenities.  Nice lobby and breakfast, the room is OK.  Recommend staying if you are looking for a reasonably priced hotel near the airport
review.negativeRemarks: Mattress in the room
review.locationRemarks: Good food nearby

review.title: For the price it was a mice experience.
review.reviewText: It was nice. I had no issues, the only down was that there isn't much privacy, you can hear everything going on outside from the room, but other than that it was nice.

hey! 
If your looking for a decent and inexpensive place to stay this is the one.
I had a Awesome experince with CitiGarden. I think the mattress could be so much better. I did not like how stiff the mattress felt.Otherwise, the room was very clean and comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: Cleanliness for the price that we paid.
review.negativeRemarks: The mattress could be improved.
review.locationRemarks: The location was great! it was roughly 15mins drive from ChinaTown. The San Bruno Mall was about 11mins, which was awesome.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText:
The room was great, clean and I liked the interior design. We had double queen bed room and there was plenty of space. The most important part was they are pet friendly and we could stay here with our fury family member. 
Also continental breakfast  exceeded our expectations .

review.title: Nice place, great value
review.reviewText: Remodeling in the works and for the price a great value near the airport

review.title: Close to convention center
review.reviewText: I just needed a place to sleep, nothing fancy. And this place is nothing fancy. The walls are thin so you hear your neighbors talking. The blanket on the bed was thin, the mattress not too comfortable. The fluorescent lights in the bathroom flickered, which was annoying. For some reason they put me in a handicap room, and for some reason that meant there were no towel racks and no countertops. There was no place in the bathroom for me to set down my toiletries, which I imagine would be equally annoying for someone in a wheelchair. I didn't complain or ask for another room because, as I said, I just needed a place to sleep close to the convention center. The free continental breakfast was nice. The large courtyard in the central area is nice. The door to the convention center was about fifty feet from where I parked my car, which was very nice.
review.positiveRemarks: It was the least expensive hotel close to the convention center.
review.negativeRemarks: Replace the light fixtures in the bathroom so they don't flicker. Put up a towel rack and a shelf in the handicap room bathroom.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the convention center. They provide a free shuttle to the airport. There is not much to do in South San Francisco.

review.title: Nice if you're not by the stairs.
review.reviewText: I stayed in a room by the stairs, got zero sleep the 3 nights I was there. I also heard everything from the upstairs room from the bathroom. It's a pretty room however, bed was a little stiff.

review.title: Dump
review.reviewText: Room door did not close properly. Came back to room one night and door was wide open. Alerted front desk and housekeeping that they had to shut door hard to close. Next night, door wide open again. Apathetic and surly staff, particularly front desk clerk on the night shift. Had no bath towels at all upon returning to room on Wednesday night, had to call front desk for housekeeping. Grounds are dirty, exterior paint is peeling or chipped, particularly exterior stair bannisters.
review.positiveRemarks: Bathroom was fairly clean and recently remodeled.
review.negativeRemarks: Service staff, night clerk do not respond to guests requests and are generally unpleasant.
review.locationRemarks: City of san Francisco

review.title: Nice for the Price
review.reviewText: Me and my girlfriend checked in here after a late night flight into SFO.  It was very convienent to get to and from AP.  The shuttle ran on time.  The staff were all nice and welcoming.  The rooms are not fancy at all, but the grounds are kept up and lobby is decent.  This being said, we ended up have a "romantic", lazy morning at the hotel the next day, which was totally unplanned.  So we ended up liking our stay here... and for the price we can't beat it!!
review.negativeRemarks: Room updates, paint the banisters on the stairs up to the rooms
review.locationRemarks: Good.  Costco nearby.  Starbucks close.

review.title: Convenient SFO airport hotel
review.reviewText: We stayed at this hotel for only one night.  It is certainly a sufficient facility for someone wanting a hotel close to the airport (SFO).  It is an older facility with commensurate "aging" issues, but the staff was quite friendly (even though they were dealing concurrently with a massive tour group who had arrived just prior to us) and the room and bathroom were both clean and neat.
review.negativeRemarks: The exteriors could use some sprucing up...but the rooms are quite sufficient (in the remodeled section)
review.locationRemarks: n.a.

review.title: Good price
review.reviewText: Hotel is a little dated with some upgrades. It was clean and the staff were friendly.

It was okay. The room was clean. The restroom was clean, too. Just a comment on the sofa, they were not that impressive, looks dirtt and uncomfortable to sit down because of cleanliness issue. I tried to lift the cushion, and wow, i found some pieces of food.
Convenient location for airport and car rental return.

review.title: Very good customer service
review.reviewText:
Clean, great service at front desk. 
Prompt to request from front desk

review.title: Low price with low expectation.
review.reviewText:
The room is okay, it has a very unpleasant smell, the light are off and the heater is broken. The bed doesn't have bed bugs which is a pros. You do get what you paid for. 
The breakfast is bad, but it is a budget hotel. The WIFI never worked.
The staff made me miss the shuttle due to wrong instruction and cannot and will not apologize for their mistake. I end up waited for almost one hour for shuttle because of their wrong instruction and poor hospitality. The shuttle driver was also very angry for some reason.
review.positiveRemarks: I booked it due to last minute travel plan changed. I found it on Expedia.
review.negativeRemarks: The staff could have been more apologetic for the mistake given on wrong instruction.
review.locationRemarks: There is IHOP near by, but I only need a place to stay for the night, so I didn't explore at all.

review.title: Not the best; mom with kids not impressed
review.reviewText:
If you enjoy listening to people in the room over having sex then this is the hotel for you. Paper thin walls. Ratty old towels and washcloths. 

Spend $15 more and stay somewhere else!

review.title: I got more than I paid for
review.reviewText: Very happy.  The room is very clean, sheets very fresh, carpet comfortable, bathroom clean, good quality thick towel, nice garden, good furniture inside room.  High quality furniture that you can only find in four stars hotel.  Comes with breakfast.  Lots of food, toast, muffin, eggs, cereal, orange juice, etc.  Large dinning area for breakfast, plenty of seats.  Near airport, comes with free WIFI, free parking, free shuttle to airport.  Clean everywhere.  Good side swimming pool.  Usually, you need to pay a lot for this kind of quality.  There is also a Chinese Buffet Restaurant in house with very reasonable price and lots of food.
review.negativeRemarks: The cleaning maids knocked on the door at 9:00am, then in 10:30 am, against at 11:05 am.  Please!
review.locationRemarks: Nearby airport, major freeways, in house Chinese Buffet Restaurant.

review.title: Nasty hotel from a horror story
review.reviewText: Not safe if traveling alone. Weird people wondering the quarters and the rooms are small and have an old smell. The room is worth $40  a night not $114.

review.title: one night not much clean room no noise
review.reviewText: stay was fine free breakfast great    gotta go/ wife adds- great customer service, I ask for a plastic spoon for my husbands snack and got two bowls, spoons, forks and napkins. When I called the front desk for an additional pillow they sent one down and we were not charged extra.
review.positiveRemarks: Quiet room faced garden.  Room clean,bed was very good.
review.negativeRemarks: Every thing was good
review.locationRemarks: We came to see San Francisco; it has been 40 years since I last visited; it is not the same city.  So many changes.  SF is a busy crowded city.

review.title: One day
review.reviewText: Not much to do around the hotel.glad I stayed one night.

review.title: Dissapointed
review.reviewText: Lamp and heater doesn't work. I was disappointed to see the room.

review.title: Convenient for overnight and connecting travellers
review.reviewText: It was short , sweet and the Chinese buffet was good for the price. And I still got to go downtown , at Sam's cable car lounge, have couple cocktails, see the Trams and barmaid Michelle @ Sam's was very warm and welcoming. Hip hip hooray for meeting friendly in the world still.

review.title: A good choice if you are not fussy.
review.reviewText: The room was clean, compact but with room to move, the a/c unit worked, the towels and toiletries were nice and the bed comfortable. The public areas (lobby, breakfast room, garden) were very nicely decorated and spacious, definitely a plus. The Front Desk staff was very helpful and polite.  The hotel is near the airport and close to the 101 freeway entrances.  The carpet might benefit from a good deep cleaning, the furniture had some dings, the a/c unit could be noisy and I could occasionally hear people in the adjoining rooms but overall the location of the hotel worked very well and it has a friendly ambience.  If I go back to San Bruno I would probably book this hotel again.
good price! Its enough to rest a couple of nights.

review.title: LIke scene from Walking Dead
review.reviewText: Nice lobby - then it gets scary. It's real 3rd world once you check in and go into the dark back aread to hunt for your room. EWifi did work.
review.positiveRemarks: nice new clean bathroom. Sheets seemed clean, otherwise pretty creepy.
review.negativeRemarks: All the rest. New furniture, carpets, curtains, etc.

review.title: Nicely refurbished hotel, very near to airport.
review.reviewText: We checked in late, and left the next morning. The beds were comfy, and the breakfast fine.
review.positiveRemarks: It was beside the airport, and near the car rental return.
review.negativeRemarks: Provide coffee and teas in the room. A shower cap would also be handy. Consistent flow of hot water.
review.locationRemarks: Car rental was nearby, and Costco.

review.title: Close to airport
review.reviewText:
After I arrived, I realized this was the same hotel that was on Hotel Impossible.  I remember seeing the show and how one room was updated with new bathroom and bedroom furniture.  

Having said that, I cannot tell if my room was updated.  The bathroom seems to be fairly new with tile surrounds.  Since I didn't see the other rooms I can't tell if it's new.  The bed clearly is not new.  

All in all, it's okay given the price paid and the proximity to the airport.  The restaurant attached is not too bad especially since it is onsite.

review.title: Pleasant hotel
review.reviewText: It was a good stay, the beds and linens were clean and nice the meal in the morning was great and I like how you can ride to and from the airport

review.title: what can I say? its was work!!
review.reviewText: overall it was a good nights rest after driving up from Los Angeles
Didn't feel comfortable at all staying here. Many hotels along this rode that appeared more safe

review.title: Great commuter / on business hotel
review.reviewText:
I usually stay at CitiGarden Hotel if I am too tired to drive to the South Bay, or need to be in San Francisco early (You can read my previous reviews). 

I haven't stayed at this hotel in a couple of years, and last I remember, they were doing some remodeling on the back end of the hotel. I didn't see any evidence of construction this time around. 

The room is perfect if you are staying in the area for the night, or are on business on the Peninsula. The bed is not all that comfortable, but its perfect if you are just looking for a place to sleep. The shower curtain rod showed signs of rust. The rest of the room was clean. 

Hotel has breakfast and coffee.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to SFO, Highway 101, San Francisco
review.negativeRemarks: Replace the shower curtain rod, and the mattress. I think the mattress is getting old.
review.locationRemarks: Located just off highway 101. About 15 mins to get to San Francisco. Very close to SFO Airport

review.title: Close to the airport
review.reviewText: It was ok. Got what we paid for. Wish the rooms were more comfortable and that the staff was a bit speedier.
review.positiveRemarks: Free shuttle to and from the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast was all carbs. Eggo waffles, serial and such. Staff was friendly, but slow.  Bed was VERY uncomfortable. toilette got clogged because cheap

review.title: Nice Motel
review.reviewText: Not the first time we have stayed at this motel. Very convenient for route 101. Comfortable quiet clean rooms
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Easy access to highway and excursions into San Francisco

review.title: Shuttle service from airport
review.reviewText: I had to pull my luggage a long way to thr room and this was difficult inasmuch as I had just come off a 16 hour flight.  I was too far away to take advantage of the 24-hour coffee service.  On the plus side, the bed was comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: For the price, nothing except a coffee pot in the room.
review.locationRemarks: Nothing that I wanted except the shuttle service back to the airport.

review.title: Good for the price
review.reviewText: Only real complaint was the mediocre breakfast buffet.

review.title: Not really a hotel, more of a motel.
review.reviewText: Rooms are in desperate need of upgrading.  20 year old tv, doors falling off of the cabinet, old dirty carpet.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to the airport with quick shuttle service.

review.title: Old hotel
review.reviewText: It's ok to stay for a night because it's near the airport but the free shuttle is really slow. There are no elevators and the rooms are outside/motel style. There is a so so free breakfast but the breakfast nazi is serious about breakfast ending at exactly10am. The front desk was very nice when we checked in and gave us a first floor room so we didn't have to lug heavy luggage up the stairs

review.title: Nice Hotel near airport
review.reviewText: It was easier to get to the airport and not too far away from downtown. The room was good and overall, great place for the paid price.

review.title: You get what you pay for!
review.reviewText: Title says it all. First the bad, furnishing is out dated, but at least the bed was comfy. Sheets are a bit rough the the comforter is very thin. The air conditioner/heater didn't work very well. The curtains don't block the sun very well. I found a cockroach running on the wall and a dead mosquito in the bathtub, other than that the room was clean, no stains on the bed sheets, sink and counter were clean toilet clean.. Etc. The phone in my room did not work, had to use my cell to contact the lobby. TV was probably for the late 80s or early 90s. Toilet kept running had to close the bathroom door. Not much is included with the room, no safe, no fridge, no microwave, no iron and no bible, little lighting and only 2 usable electrical outlets. Good news is that they are doing construction on the rooms, which made it noisy, but by the time I post this review hopefully they are done with the renovations. Things that were included with the room shampoo, soap, hair dryer, extra pillows. The hotel is gated, but it's in a good neighborhood anyway, so safety wasn't really a concern. A Chinese buffet is connected to the hotel, which is convenient. Continental breakfast was way better than I expected it to be, hot waffles, pancakes, bagels, cereal. Lobby, garden and lounge area are surprisingly nice. Parking was sparse, I recommend being a bit early for check in to get good parking. The hotel staff are extremely friendly. Overall I would recommend this hotel to someone on a tight budget.

Evidently there is new management at CitiGarden from when I stayed on 8 other times.  You took out the charm of the sitting room and replaced it with hard surface tables and chairs. The chairs and sofa need replacing I would not want my grandparents sitting in them.  The breakfast is really scimpy.  You are a hotel why not treat your guests right.  Having a Costco down the street should be a convenient way to purchase more edible food-sweet rolls, fresh fruit, bagels, etc.  Folks like to have fresh waffles so purchasing two waffle makers purchased at Costco would give your guest the feeling of home and have something warm to eat in addition to the boiled eggs.
review.positiveRemarks: I like that it was close to San Francisco to get to Cirque de Solei.
review.negativeRemarks: You took out the charm of the sitting room and replaced it with hard surface tables and chairs. The chairs and sofa need replacing I would not want my

review.title: nice room for the price
review.reviewText: room was clean, bathroom was better than I expected. Very clean and modest. Nice furniture. Better than the trace lodge and they're aboutthe same Price.
This is an excellent hotel close to airport, room is comfortable.

review.title: Nice Concrete walls between rooms for quiet nights
review.reviewText:
1. When I made reservation, I requested a ground level room facing the courtyard.  She assigned me a room upstairs facing the parking lot. She said I requested that in my reservation until I showed my copy of printout.  She said if I want a room facing the courtyard, it will be $10 extra per night, which is called upgrade. The hotel should make it clear on the website that "standard room" means rooms facing the parking lot.
2. She said the ground level room was wet so she gave me the upstairs room, and I have bad knees and a senior citizen.  She finally gave me a ground level room, but the AC and Heater do not work.  They finally changed the room for me.
3. I stayed in this motel previously many times.  There was no such thing as standard room and upgrades.
4. Rooms are clean, simple.  Great for short stay if everything works.
review.positiveRemarks: The thick concrete walls between rooms to block next door noise.  The court yard is pleasant.  The breakfast is quite nice.
review.negativeRemarks: Make everything clear at the hotel website, and respect and honor customers' reservation request.  If the request can't be honored, cancel the booking
review.locationRemarks: Not much around other than a nice Chinese buffet restaurant.

review.title: clean, tidy hotel near the airport.
review.reviewText: Staff were great; welcoming and friendly especially when checking in the middle of the night.

review.title: NICE ENTRANCE OLD ROOM
review.reviewText: The curb appeal of the motel is nice. The lobby and meeting rooms look nice. The rooms are old and small. The garden area in the common is attractive and the coffee in the lobby is good.  The cont. breakfast was pancakes and breads...no meat.  I did not eat anything there. In short, this was like an old motel 6 that had been bought by a cheap investor.  I will not be back.
review.positiveRemarks: Coffee in lobby and garden area in center commons.
review.negativeRemarks: Room AC that works/gets cold.  Upgrade fm local channels to cable with movies. Something for meat lovers on the cont breakfast. Paint trim of bldgs.
review.locationRemarks: Great location in SF bay area.  Fisherman's Wharf etc 12 miles. Sanforan shopping center about 4 miles.

review.title: Not a bad price
review.reviewText:
I pretty much got what I paid for.
Definitely a cut above the Travel Lodge, across the street, as far as cleanliness and fixtures.
review.positiveRemarks: Its most attractive feature for me is its proximity to the Holiday Inn N Airport Hotel (a parking lot separates the two).

review.title: Okay hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is near airport so I could hear the airplanes landing and taking off in the middle of the night. I could also hear the cars running on highways. However, since I was so tired from a tour around SF, I could manage to fall into sleep. The breakfast was not decent but still edible with ego waffle, pancakes, and wheat bread, cereal, and quaker oatmeal. If you are sensitive to price, go for it. The bed is pretty comfy but the outermost sheet is old.
review.negativeRemarks: cleanliness of bed. The bed sheet is old.
review.locationRemarks: 15 minutes from SFO via airport shuttle. good.

review.title: Loud too close to the airport
review.reviewText:
If you are a light sleeper this is NOT the hotel for you. The planes from the airport where taking off until after midnight and then started up again early in the morning.
The food at the restaurant was not very good.
review.negativeRemarks: Better restaurant.
review.locationRemarks: Close to airport.

review.reviewText: Old, with just the basic amenities, but clean and spacious rooms. Conveniently located right next to the airport, good for a short and affordable stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Location (close to the airport, allowing easy access to both downtown San Francisco and the peninsula.
review.negativeRemarks: Needs to be renovated and redecorated. The breakfast was hardly adequate in terms of variety and quality.

review.reviewText:
-Hotel was a very old style that they'd tried to upgrade.  Credit given for new fixtures (bathtub, sink, counter, etc.) Unfortunately, it wasn't enough to compensate for the overall feel of a dingy room.
-We placed a hand towel on the desk chair before we would even consider using it. Completely covered in large stains.
-Would have been a plus to have a small refrigerator was provided in the room.
-Not enough parking close to our room.  We had to park around the building.  
-Several units were utilized as storage units with furniture etc. just piled in.  Completely understandable, but close the blinds as customers don't need to see this.
-Information binder in room for nearby restaurants listed Costco and McDonalds.  Not your normal type of references.
-Room rate should have been equivalent to a Motel 6, but definitely wasn't.
review.positiveRemarks: It was a place to rest our heads and the towels were relatively soft which I was surprised at considering the rest of the room.
review.negativeRemarks: More of a Motel 6 level of room without the Motel 6 price tag.

review.title: Overpriced for a tired hotel
review.reviewText: Normally a hotel has hallways and elevators.  This "hotel" has neither, lending the comparison to a motel.  It was convenient to SFO with a free airport shuttle every 30 minutes.  One selling factor is their offer of a FREE breakfast.  Be aware that this is basically a bare-bones continental breakfast of breads, pre-made pancakes and waffles that go into a toaster.  There's cereal, coffee, tea and processed instant oatmeal.  There is NO fruit, yogurt or other staples of a continental breakfast.  Had I known this breakfast was so dismal, I would have gotten breakfast elsewhere.  The Chinese buffet next door is disappointing as well.  It was either the buffet or "breakfast" that gave me an upset stomach later in the morning.  Otherwise, the stay is okay if a nice bed, pillow is not a priority.  The value is what was most disappointing -- cut the rate by 60% and it would have been fair.  C'est la vie!
review.positiveRemarks: Free shuttle to SFO.  That's about all.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast needs help.  Black mold needs to be treated in bathroom tiles.  This property used to be a fine hotel - not anymore.  Very tired hotel!
review.locationRemarks: Take the free shuttle to SFO and get a ticket on Bart into the city.  If you're over 65, take advantage of the senior rate at the Information Kiosk.

review.title: Ugh
review.reviewText: There's not much to say, except "worst $200 I've ever spent." Ridiculously rude morning front desk staff (though to be fair, the evening staff where delightful); moldy bathroom on tiles, ceiling, and curtain; most uncomfortable bed ever; dirty, icky floor; got a knock on my door from employee in middle if night. Need I go on? FYI: laundry facilities are $2.75 to wash and $2.50 to dry; soap is $2.

review.title: Not worth the cost
review.reviewText:
Fair room, but for the following.
Lighting is very dim.  Wife struggled to see to put on makeup.
Carpet was stained and looked dirty.
Pillows were hard.
Lobby looked great...trying to make a good first Impresion.
Grounds were not kept too well.  Outer rooms looked like they were in an alley.

review.title: Convenient and Affordable
review.reviewText:
It is an old hotel, with good location and AFFORDABLE. There are no hotels in San Francisco area below $150 dlls and the ones in that price range should be in same conditions.

PROS: It is well located, close to the airport, they have shuttle every 30 min, there are bus routes in front of the hotel directly to downtown, it has breakfast and free parking.

CONS: It is old, some areas are surrounded by garbage containers, the outside of the rooms are ugly, the rooms area small.

Just a walk thru the parking and you can take route 292 to downtown San Francisco (1 block from Union Square) for $2.25 ($4.00 the return trip). That is convenient. If you rented a car, the parking is free, most of the hotels closer to the city charge you 15-30 dlls for the parking, so this is also great.
review.locationRemarks: It is a hotel just for sleeping after a day in the move, as long as you think of it that way, you are fine.

review.title: Only one night
review.reviewText:
I used this hotel for only one night after I came back Las Vegas. 
And next day I had to leave SF.
So it's convenient to move to other areas because it's near the SFO airport. Shuttle buses are free and breakfast is simple, but free. 
The best made me feel happy was the spacious and beautiful garden between the apartments.

review.title: A 1 star at best
review.reviewText: The hotel has 1 thing going for it-a shuttle to/from the airport. The hotel is a glorified motel that has seen better days for sure. For the same $ I'd stay elsewhere.

review.title: Airport Letdown
review.reviewText: The hotel was fine on check in - lobby and area dated but clean and welcoming - but the room did not live up to the lobby's billing.  We had asked and paid for a king sized bed.  We did not get one.  The bathroom was ok as far as cleanliness went but there were old stains on the walls and carpet and the bedspread did not appear to have been washed in months.  We removed it immediately.  I would not recommend this hotel and would not stay in it again.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms need to be updated and cleaner.
review.locationRemarks: Location to airport was good.  Shuttle service was excellent.

review.title: Close to SFO
review.reviewText: This hotel was horribly over-priced but we chose it based on its proximity to the airport.  Certain members of the front desk staff were completely preoccupied by phone inquiries versus taking care of the 10 plus people waiting in line to check in.  The room was very basic and although not dirty, did not give a real sense of comfort.  We didn't take our socks off until we were in bed.  Given the other options available to us, the CitiGarden worked out for our needs, but if I can help it, I will not be staying there again.
review.negativeRemarks: Certain members of the front desk staff need remedial customer service training.

review.reviewText: nice staff, clean bathroom. old hotel bed spread type motel.

review.title: Towels
review.reviewText: There were no towels of any kind in the room.  Requested a set and still did not receive washcloths.  Had to get the cloths from personnel working near the laundry.
review.positiveRemarks: There was service to the airport.

review.title: sukx
review.reviewText: room small and old over sfo flight path....I paid cash for one room...they charged mycc $251

review.title: Close to the airport is it's only selling point.
review.reviewText: I had a flight delay so ended up staying in San Francisco for the night.  This hotel was close and a decent price so I went for it.  First off the check in process took FOREVER.  I don't know what kind've software they are using, but I think it may need a serious upgrade.  The young man behind the counter was not in any kind've hurry and wasn't exactly friendly.  The bathrooms in the main hallway were a complete mess. They did offer a free breakfast which was great, but the dining room was so dirty! The room itself was a little outdated, but you can tell they tried to make some upgrades.  It got very few channels and the reception was horrible.  The room size was decent.  It was just an "okay" experience, I would not recommend.
review.positiveRemarks: Breakfast. Proximity to airport.  Online booking.

review.title: The hotel was ok.  It was comfortable.
review.reviewText: The dcor was outdated and the carpets were dirty but the beds were comfortable.  The TV was very old maybe a 20 inch from the 1980s the old big cathode ray tube tv.  There were no towels when we first got there.  There was no coffee maker with coffee in the room.  No refrigerator or microwave.  I guess you get what you pay for.  I had to attend a wedding and I had to reserve a room for 8 people.  I mainly choose this place because of the cost as I had to stay there for a couple of days.  Thankfully I did not need to spend much time in the room other than to sleep in.
review.positiveRemarks: The price and that it was easy to find.
review.negativeRemarks: Put a coffee machine in the room.  Update the dcor and clean the carpets.  Also get a flat screen for the rooms and make sure there are towels.
review.locationRemarks: It was located near the freeway and convenient to get to.  There was an IHOP restaurant down the street and that is where I had to go to get coffee.

review.title: Convenient - Close to the Airport
review.reviewText:
The staff was helpful and pleasant. The lobby is very appealing and captures your interest.It could be because I got in late at night and had been travelling for hours but the layout of the place was confusing. The room was small but didn't mattered much as it served its purpose; a shut eye for a few hours. It is conveniently situated next to the airport and the shuttle service was effective.

The place was clean which made it so much easier to take a power nap I needed before continuing my travels. I would recommend this hotel for its convenience and cleanliness but only as a stop over for few hours or a couple of days.
review.positiveRemarks: The Staff, location (close to the airport) and the shuttle service.

review.title: Noise and stinky place to stay
review.reviewText: The rooms are like Motel's. It lacks common things like coffee machine, microwave and mini-fridge found in equivalent hotels. The Carpet was dirty. Walk for a while with bare foot and it get darker after a couple steps and you can see dirty patches on it (room 302). There is no sound proof window/door. you will hear all planes departure and people steps walking dragging their bags on the path. You will also hear people walking in the rooms upstairs. Some rooms are across the Ice machine and I am so sorry for those staying there. There is a Chinese restaurant in the same building and all smell from the kitchen blows toward the rooms (fried sea foot smell).
review.positiveRemarks: They do have a nice lobby and the "free" breakfast is decent. Shuttle Service is very good and they stick well with the schedule.
review.negativeRemarks: replace the carpets, add sound proof window/doors, move the Ice machines away from rooms, add fridge, cofee, microwave and close the restaurant.
review.locationRemarks: Conveniently close to the SF Airport.

review.title: Hotel close to SFO Airport

Depending on which runway planes went from, the noise of planes could be an issue for light sleepers.

Although no bar on site, the Holiday Inn is a 2 min walk.

It was a Good
Experience and a great service in the hotel

The pool was unavailable/locked. The noise of frequent jets taking off got to be a good "white noise" after a while. Poor pillows, but firm mattress. TV channel listings not accurate. The heater worked well, and the water was hot. The lobby was pretty, but not very welcoming. The lawn/garden area looked a little neglected/sad. There was an attached Asian buffet, but the smell was very strong.

review.title: Open air facility! Beware of unwanted visitors!
review.reviewText: First, the front desk saw that we had a cart FULL of luggage but they gave us a second floor room and there are NO elevators. Front desk worker seemed overall disinterested. Then, around 11:00pm, I got a knock on my door from a man claiming he had a delivery and when I talked to him through the door he said "open the door, I can't hear you." Well, I didn't but visitors should know that this facility is open air...ANYONE can enter the hotel and it felt unsafe. When I didn't open the door, he finally went away but it made for a long night. When I immediately phoned front desk guy (yep, same one), he was blaze' about it and said he'd "make a note." (!!) Unbelievable. Also, people were on the balcony talking and smoking cigarettes throughout the night. Classy joint. I've paid half as much for hotels 10 times better. Avoid it!!
review.positiveRemarks: not much. Maybe the exit. Well, the rooms are nicely appointed, but it's still a motor lodge, through and through.
review.negativeRemarks: The "continental breakfast" was shameful at best and the breakfast room was a complete mess...filthy. They should be embarrassed. They don't care.

review.negativeRemarks: Morning Breakfast
