review.title: OK for a short night
review.reviewText: I booked this hotel for a short overnight stay because it was relatively inexpensive and near the airport -- and got exactly what I paid for. The hotel's facilities are not great and need updates and new rugs; the breakfast is mediocre at best, there are no major newspapers. OK for the price, but barely.

review.title: No dealbreakers
review.reviewText: Despite the mixed reviews, I booked a room here for 2 nights; good location, reasonable price. It's not the Ritz but the room was clean and the beds comfortable. They forgot to stock soap in the room, but the clerk at the front desk gave me whatever I asked for. Carpets are old and warn, but didn't impact my stay. Lots of options for restaurants right around the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Amenities
review.locationRemarks: It's right near the airport and the highway into the city; very convenient.

review.title: I'll come back again.
review.reviewText: The room was nice, the bathroom is what really stood out as very nice. The tv was small and out dated, but that wasn't important to my stay:) The pool looks well maintained, I hope to use it next time. Also the checkout and check in was painless, and the complimentary breakfast was awesome!

review.title: Old remodeled motel
review.reviewText:
Pros: Near airport, not far from SF proper, decent rate, enjoys bay breeze keeping things nice during summer heat

Cons: Stayed in one of the back sections in the 400s on the second floor and the staircase was clearly not re-painted during the remodel with rust visible (might need a shot if you get cut), thin walls, mildew on the bathroom ceiling due to no exhaust fan, and a mandatory additional $30 fee charged to my credit card for potential incidentals which I didn't use which was then reversed
review.negativeRemarks: Thin walls, no bathroom fans, stop charging fees before they have been incurred

review.title: The desk staff and the maids
review.reviewText:
The hotel desk staff were not very cordial, helpful, nor did they seem very knowledgeable about their job. Rarely did you get a smile
from them. Most hotels give you free access to the Internet, Citi Garden charged $3.00. The front desk didn't even have a note pad
to write on as I stood their trying to get some information. Except for one female of the maid staff, it was terrible. Four of the ten
nights we stayed there the maid only left one wash cloth. The carpet was filthy, needed to be cleaned. They didn't vacuum the room
for the first week. The room had no note pad nor pen. They don't even have flat screen TVs. We misplaced one of our room key
cards, when they gave us the replacement card it was same card.
review.positiveRemarks: Thye only thing I can say good about this facility is the continental breakfast that they served each morning.
review.negativeRemarks: Change the entire staff of the Motel, because it is not a Hotel.
review.locationRemarks: The location was 10 miles from the city. There was nothing to do in the area, and only 4 places to eat, Dennys, Houlihans, Chinese and IHOP.

review.title: Close to the airport, with reliable shuttle
review.reviewText: If all you need is a place to sleep before an early morning flight, this is it. If you want something more, go somewhere else.

review.title: Hotel old. Rooms outdated, but clean
review.reviewText: personnel working front desk very nice. The hotel is old and looks worn out, but price reasonable and room clean. Shower good.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms need to be updated
review.locationRemarks: Near airport, San Francisco easy freeway access

review.title: clean, convenient, friendly
review.reviewText: I stayed on two occasions, the second by choice since I had found the 1st night to be pleasant. The hotel is clean and well maintained, the location is convenient and the staff is friendly and courteous. It is an older property so there is some wear but it is well maintained and I would return again if in the area.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, convenient, courteous all at a good price
review.negativeRemarks: nothing in particular
review.locationRemarks: it is right off the 101 north of SFO

review.title: Nice hotel, close to SFO
review.reviewText: The facilites were fine. I wish they hadn't charged $7 per day to leave my car there while I flew away.

review.title: Quick Stop Near the Airport
review.reviewText: I had to get a hotel for a very short stay. I got in to SFO very late, so I wanted to make sure I could stay nearby because the next day I was going to a new destination. It was super quick to the hotel and convenient with the shuttle. Rooms were fine for a 12 hour stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Revamp rooms, nicer bedding

review.title: ok for one night
review.reviewText: We checked in around midnight, got a room at the back of the hotel, so it wasn't noisy. Someone had been in our room prior to us getting there & the bathroom vanity was wet, 2 glasses were dirty & the bath towel was over the shower wet . We were so tired we just went to bed, When we went down to breakfast (horrible) cereal, toast & bagels, I went to the front desk to get clean towels & the girl there was really nice when I told her what happened. She apologized numerous times & said she would take care of it, Ok hotel if you're not staying long
review.positiveRemarks: close to airport , girl at front desk in the morning
review.negativeRemarks: cleanliness of room & breakfast
review.locationRemarks: wasn't there long enough

review.title: close to airport and restaurants.pillows and bed
review.reviewText: Hotel was close to airport for conveniece. Beijing Buffet restaurant was next to hotel and was very convenient. The food was very good and the lunch buffet value was great. I had choice of rooms to choose from. I picked a lemon. The telephone in the room was missing a cable, rendering unusable. Bathroom door doesn"t lock. One vanity light bulb was out .We traded for another room.It was basically good except, toilet was clogged- matter was reported and unclogged same day. There were many spotty stains on the carpeting that looked unsightly. Some of the check-in personnel weren"t so inviting and helpful. One was in particular helpful. Breakfast was good- offered from 6:30am to 9:30am.
review.positiveRemarks: Pillows and bed sheets seems to be clean. Close to Beijing restaurant. Close to Dennys restaurant.
review.negativeRemarks: Maintain all rooms before issuing out. Things in the room malfunctioning or missing. Carpets was soiled and worn. Check-in personnel needs training.

review.title: Good deal for the price
review.reviewText:
Clean and nice room. Good to have a garden outside . Good price, and a little breakfast included.
Downside: the airplane noises, that did not bother me so much.
Nice lobby , and nice staff. Would stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: The garden and the room and bathroom was clean.
review.negativeRemarks: Free wifi in the bedrooms would be a plus.
review.locationRemarks: I did not look around, I just needed a place to stay to go to a class...

review.title: Go location near SFO.
review.reviewText: We had 2 water related problems that they couldn't fix and we had to move to another room at 11pm at night - very inconvenient.
review.positiveRemarks: Lobby and front of hotel looks great. Rooms are B grade at best.

review.title: Cheap hotel, good for one night
review.reviewText: Everything was fine. The room could have been cleaner but for one night it wasn't a big deal. The hotel is attached to a Chinese restaurant called Beijing Buffet. DO NOT eat there. The food was okay but the staff was terrible. The host at the front was extremely rude.
review.negativeRemarks: Provide water in the rooms
review.locationRemarks: Don't go to the Beijing Buffet next door because they are really rude.

review.title: hotel staff at front desk RUDE
review.reviewText: There was NO COLD WATER IN SHOWER OR TUB we had to take a bath with scalding hot water & go to the Ice machine & pour buckets of ice in the bath tub to get clean on a 3 day stay. Pool is cold , no way to get in to swim. Front desk does NOT want to be bothered at ANY time EVEN checking you in hidden $40.00 dollar fee at check in , I asked what for.? It was incase we mess the room up . Gee don't the maids make the beds????? Never stay there again Terrable place tp stay Pillows PAPER THIN> Bring your own.
review.negativeRemarks: Hire a more friendly staff & get cold water fixed
review.locationRemarks: NOTHING,We go into San Francisco & Im a San Francisco Native 4th Generation too.

review.title: Nice except for silverfish
review.reviewText: What amenities there were were acceptable. However, I killed a silverfish the second day I was there. It had drowned in some water near my toothbrush. Because of where it was, I was very suspicious. I washed my toothbrush afterward. I buried the silverfish in the trash. Yuk!
review.negativeRemarks: More choices for breakfast. Fruit, hot cereal, for example.
review.locationRemarks: Pacifica and Rockaway Beaches were fun to visit.

review.title: disappointing.
review.reviewText: floor is dirty. noise around you is heard inside the room. i didn't have a good sleep on my 2-day stay. there's shd be a microwave or fridge for this price though hotel is not pricey. there's shd be a complimentary drinking water, at least 2 bottles. it wouldn't hurt the hotel's budget as water is only $1 per bottle which I had to buy from the front desk at 12am coz we arrived late. there's not even a coffee maker. simple things that should be in a regular cheap hotel are not here. though this hotel is not expensive, for $128/night, I think it's just fair that I can have 2 bottles of drinking water. My irritation was saved by the courteous and very polite staff named Ben.
review.negativeRemarks: pls read comment above. thx.

review.title: costa Lota.
review.reviewText: The staff went very helpful. Hotel looks shabby from the outside. Room decor was old and tired. I stayed in this hotel as it was a special online cheap deal. If I would have paid the full price I would have complained. I feel this hotel is charging to much. Thanks
review.negativeRemarks: Old decor
review.locationRemarks: Close to airport

review.title: Affordable option if you are in a hurry.
review.reviewText: Very nice foyer, but that is where the money is. No wifi...mold growing above shower...not cool if your wife is with you.

review.title: HOTEL facilities varied with unit
review.reviewText:
I stayed there twice, before the trip I was in a room in the building on SW of property. The furnishings seemed old and rather worn. The parking for Fly/stay was rather far away than on previous visits - a problem for me as I have walking difficulties.
On my return I was put in a handicapped room which was very different - larger, brighter and with more attractive furnishings.
I used the shuttle to the airport in both directions. On the way to the airport the timetable indicated that Terminal One was the last stop. The driver passed Terminal One and stopped at the next terminal and insisted that I had to get off and that I was at the right spot - which I knew very well was wrong.
I was at the Southwest area. No one there could help me get the wheel chair I had requested and pointed me of to the right where I knew I had to go. I began to drag my two pieces of luggage towards Terminal One. Some time later I met a security man on a bicycle and he helped me towards the UN desk. Finally I got a wheel chair and was taken to the boarding area five minutes before boarding began. I been at the airport just over two hours doing more than I was really physically able.
One my return to the hotel I tried to tell the desk clerk about the problems I had since the shuttle use is part of their service. She was not only totally disinterested but darned right rude. I shall never use this hotel again.
review.positiveRemarks: originally its convenience to the airport
review.negativeRemarks: Personnel, some assistance with luggage for arriving passengers
review.locationRemarks: Of no interest to me.

review.title: Basic but nice clean and family safe
review.reviewText: Basic hotel but secure and friendly staff. Good central location and a nice place.

review.title: A Hidden Treasure
review.reviewText: Having booked the unadvertised rate hotel, we didn't expect much. It turned out to be the best one of our entire trip. Everyting was great -- furniture, beds, bathroom. Much of the installations appeared new.
review.positiveRemarks: The lobby is elegant. The business center well-equipped.
review.negativeRemarks: A covered swimming pool would be nice. It was to cool for swimming when we were there, which is probably trued of many days in a San Francisco summer
review.locationRemarks: Near airport, but kind of far from the tourist destinations.

review.title: You get what you pay for.
review.reviewText: Asked for extra towels twice, never delivered. Pillows hard and uncomfortable. TV just basic cable, no SF Giants game. Bkfst mediocre.. Worst waffles I ever had. No place in bathroom to put toiletries bag. cheap plastic glassed in room. No upright bike in fitness center.
review.positiveRemarks: coffee ok. good shower. convenient to SFO
review.negativeRemarks: see above
review.locationRemarks: Just checked in, went to bed and got up and went to airport.

review.title: Clean motel with centrally located.
review.reviewText:
Check in went fine the room was clean the air cond worked well.
The motel is comprised of two buildings on a busy road, the satellite building
has small difficult parking under the building. Overall a clean motel
that made the Warf to Warf run possible.

review.title: not great, but do-able
review.reviewText: First of all, my room was facing the south side of the property, and the proximity to the South San Francisco Conference Center was part of the problem. Room locations on other parts of the property were probably better. Starting at 4:30 or 5:00a.m., really loud trucks were going in and out of the center Friday and Saturday (it was quiet on Sunday). Next, the sconces on the walls next to the beds weren't plugged in b/c their cords didn't reach any of the outlets, which wasn't a big deal, just weird. Also, I elected to do a full city tour with Tower Tours b/c the hotel staff told me it was going to be a certain amount of time and that I would be back at the hotel by a certain time, and that was incorrect information. When waiting to get picked up by the shuttle to return to the airport, the hotel staff told me that I didn't have to stand outside and wait. Unfortunately, the shuttle driver just drove past the hotel after he "didn't see anyone waiting in the lobby" and I had to take a cab b/c I didn't want to wait 25 more minutes for it to come back around. The good news, was that the taxi ride to the airport was quick and under $20.
review.positiveRemarks: Continental breakfast ran from 6:30 to 9:30, which was nice. It didn't offer any fruit or protein sources of any kind though. Shuttle from airport
review.locationRemarks: Not having a car really limits your choices of where you can walk to eat.

review.title: Strictly For The Night
review.reviewText: We checked in late, around 10pm. Asked for a room with two double beds and had only rooms with one bed available. I booked online so knew that I was taking a chance in not getting two beds. I did get a rollaway brought in, but it was pretty pathetic. The mattress was sagging in the middle and was hard to sleep on. The room was clean, but in definite need of a makeover. The staff was polite, but not overly welcome. They were dealing with a full house and apparently overbooked some of the rooms so I was lucky to get what I got. The free breakfast served is continental... with cereal, toast and frozen waffles/pancakes as main dishes so don't expect anything extravagant. Overall, this hotel is what it is advertised... a budget hotel that provides a few amenities for your money.
review.positiveRemarks: The shuttle service to the airport is free. Very nice!
review.negativeRemarks: Upgrade and provide better bedding! I felt like I was sleeping on sheets and blankets that had been used for years.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the airport and so convenient if you are traveling by air.

review.title: you need to do something about it.
review.reviewText: missing remote control battery cover, towel hanger broke, old style small screen TV, no free WIFI in the room, no coffee maker, no refri in the room, noise from the next room...even a foot step like a earthquake. would never go back again. and it's not cheap!

review.title: clean hotel close to airport
review.reviewText: A relatively cheap, clean hotel near to the airport. If you've got a late flight into or early flight out of SFO it's a good place to stay.

review.title: Conveniently close to SFO
review.reviewText: I thought we had booked a room with two queen sized beds but they gave us two double beds. For 4 people 6' tall it was disappointing.
review.positiveRemarks: clean, they had a decent breakfast
review.negativeRemarks: Queen size beds, faster check in. I had a prepaid reservation and it still took a long time for them to get us into a room.

review.title: Very Noisy
review.reviewText: Don't stay at this hotel (motel). The walls and windows in this place are like paper. We could even here the guy in the other room brushing his teeth. We woke up to the sound of delivery trucks and some other commercial building clanging away. We have stayed in several hotels/motels including Super 8 motel and this hotel was worse than that. If you do not want sleep and want to hear your neighbors throughout the night than you could stay here.
review.negativeRemarks: Sound proofing.

review.title: Rating of 2 out of 5
review.reviewText: I stayed three night at the CitiGarden hotel in July. The grounds are very nice and well taken care of but no real place to sit and enjoy. The bed was uncomfortable and made noise when you moved at all. I paid for the wireless inroom internet since I had some business to take care of during my stay. There was not enough signal fopr my I Pad to connect and I was in one of the rooms closest to the lobby. I had to go into the lobby area to connect and the connection you pay for is not secure so I would have been better off using the free internet in the lobby. It appeared the hotel was filled with tour buses and there was constant traffic up and down the stairs all day and night. The pick up at the airport was a 45 minute wait which was frustrating. I caught the first (4:15 am) shuttle back to the airport so I wouldn't be late for my flight. I would rate this hotel a 2 out of 5
review.positiveRemarks: I went through one of the unpublished rate sites so I got a reasonable price on the room. The grounds were well taken care of.

review.title: "Glorified motel"
review.reviewText: Needed a room for an overnight stay. Room was ok. No hand soap. My friends rm next door didn't have towels. Staff was not friendly or prompt. Would not stay again.
review.positiveRemarks: It was the only place with rooms available same day.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff friendliness and promptness. Better stocked rooms.

review.title: Clean, quiet, and a comfortable 3 night stay.
review.reviewText: The location of this hotel was very convenient, especially for my 3 night stay. It was clean, comfortable, quiet, and had a beautiful courtyard garden. The staff were quick and helpful, and when there was a small problem with my room key they were quickly accomodating.
review.positiveRemarks: The beautiful garden, room cleanliness, and daily room service cleaning during our stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Perhaps for the pool hours to be extended.
review.locationRemarks: The Academy of sciences was amazing, as well as the piers and fisherman's wharf.

review.title: Nice lobby
review.reviewText: Nice lobby, close to air port. Rooms are clean but old, need to up date TV in rooms.

review.title: it is a convenient hotel
review.reviewText: close to airport. The room is clean. a simple continental breakfast.

review.title: Dirty Carpet and Chairs
review.reviewText: The carpet in the room was filthy and stains on the chairs. I refused to sit on on the chairs. In addition, there was a tiny old tv that did not work. The bathroom was clean and worked ok, but I couldn't wait to get out.
review.negativeRemarks: New carpet and a new TV.
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco is a great place with many attractions.

review.title: OK
review.reviewText: Staying here was an all around OK experience. For the rate paid, I would take OK more often than not.
review.positiveRemarks: It was cheap and better than awful.
review.negativeRemarks: I guess it could be even cheaper.
review.locationRemarks: I don't know, I just slept there.

review.title: Nice upgrade but how about the bed?
review.reviewText:
the front entrance is right next to a buffet place.
Pros
nice upgrade
cons
beds need a upgrade
review.positiveRemarks: The upgrade of the bathroom and sink looks very modern but the outside just look like a truck stop motel
review.negativeRemarks: the bed made more noise then the outside everytime i turn around i can hear the bed.
review.locationRemarks: locations close to airport

review.title: disappointing old motel with a new lobby
review.reviewText: old motel. old rooms. dingy carpet and bedding. cheap continental breakfast but nice lobby
review.negativeRemarks: old carpet , older comforters

review.title: Narrow room and disappointing staff
review.reviewText:
The room is so narrow and all furnitures are old. Some staffs looks so sad and not friendly. One staff just put a bad bed and then left without any help.
Breakfast and room service are good.

review.title: Ok place; you get what you pay for
review.reviewText: Overall ok stay, given I only needed an inexpensive place to layover for a night (close to the airport). Nothing fancy, clean/basic room, small TV; the bed I had creaked each time I turned/moved while sleeping, so light sleepers might be affected. Note that the in-room Wifi is chargeable (free in the lobby area); didn't use the in-room Wifi as I was only there for a night (and the signal strength didn't look promising). Also, food options are limited around the area.
review.positiveRemarks: Inexpensive, near to airport. Good for layover.
review.negativeRemarks: Not the Ritz, for sure. You get what you pay for.

review.title: Close to SFO
review.reviewText: I needed a place to stay that was close to the airport so I could make my early morning flight in plenty of time. About the only nice thing I can say is that this place is close to the airport. Otherwise, spend a few extra dollars and stay somewhere else.
review.negativeRemarks: Completely gut the place and start over. Massive complex being renovated in stages, but certainly has seen better days.
review.locationRemarks: Near SFO and 15 minutes to San Francisco.

review.title: No internet connection in rooms
review.reviewText: No internet connection in rooms, wired or wireless.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking and internet connection

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: stayed here to catch an early flight in the morning.
review.positiveRemarks: close proximity to the airport, convenience of shuttle service
review.locationRemarks: easy walk to McDonald's. other hotels nearby.

review.title: Avg airport hotel, very helpful staff
review.reviewText: The room and hotel in general was average for an airport hotel, but the staff was very accommodating when i showed up 6 hours late for check-in (flight delays), and let me extend my checkout time for free.
review.negativeRemarks: Easier inter-hotel calling from in-room phone. (there didn't seem to be a way to call the front desk without dialing an outside number)
review.locationRemarks: 5 minutes from SFO, not much else nearby

review.title: The property is disappointing.
review.reviewText: I will not come back in this hotel. I will not come back in this hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: The entire hotel except the lobby.
review.locationRemarks: Not very exciting

review.title: Good for the price, easy drive to downtown SF
review.reviewText: It's a nice hotel, the interior doesn't match the exterior, it's much nicer inside than you'd expect. Got a good deal through reserving online, wouldn't want to pay more than a 100 a night though, since its right by the airport ( you can hear the planes landing) and the highway noise is muted, but constant. Only 20 or so minutes to downtown San Francisco, and I was there on a Saturday, so as long as you avoid the worst rush hours, it's not bad. Area is a little sketchy though, I did deadbolt and chain every time I got into my room, even if I was just there for few minutes. Was there 2 nights, overall had a good experience for what I paid.
review.negativeRemarks: The continental breakfast.

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText: I relaly liked citigarden, and being a visitor from Los Angeles who drove in - it was easy to find and get to. I really liked how clean it was, the friendly staff, and the breakfast was good.
review.negativeRemarks: needs fridge inside
review.locationRemarks: it was convenient to access and park and near the freeway

review.title: Average stay
review.reviewText: It was a good for the price. We called to check on a late check in and got hung up on twice. No refrigerator and offered no help when i explained that we had medication for our daughter that had to be refrigerated. Over all it was ok but would not come back.
review.negativeRemarks: Refrigerator in room or at least an option for one. Work on friendliness .

review.title: Surprised
review.reviewText: It took me one hour to check in at about 10 pm, Then I found no tower in the room after taking the shower. Then, I found there was no cold water from the faucet. It was a night of surprise.
review.negativeRemarks: Management can certainly be improved. Some facelift may be needed.

review.title: Room carpet dirty, do not say!
review.reviewText: Horrible, room has dirty carpet, do not have bath towels
review.negativeRemarks: Yes, cleanses, free wifi, better breakfast
review.locationRemarks: None

review.title: Good price and great location
review.reviewText: It was a very decent and inexpensive stay. Location was great. Highly recommended if you are looking for a place to sleep and go to the airport the next day.

review.title: I wouldn't stay here again
review.reviewText: Stayed at this hotel cause I wanted to save a few bucks but was pretty disappointed. I knew not to expect to much so the fact that everything here is ancient was expected. The windows and doors in this place don't block any noise. Every time someone walked by or closed there car door I could here it. So if you want a quite early night don't stay here. If you do though make sure you stay in the inner part of the hotel and not the outside part(where I did) because car doors opening, closing will ruin your stay. Also they charge $8 a day for wifi
review.positiveRemarks: Location. Very close to the Airport if you have a early flight.
review.negativeRemarks: Doors and windows so noise doesn't keep you up.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the Airport and there is a Ihop across the street and a 7-11 a couple minutes drive away.

review.title: Well maintained for a cheap hotel. good location
review.reviewText: This hotel was ok, well connected to San Francisco by samtrans buses and caltrain and had shuttle frequently to airport. Room was decent (you have to really bang the door to close it), staff was friendly. No free wifi except in lobby. There was lot of noise in the night (specially the side which faces South San Francisco convention center) so you can have trouble sleeping. Continental breakfast was ok, not many choices but clean and nicely maintained. For the price I was expecting much worse but was pleasantly surprised. There is a Chinese buffet on premises but I didn't got option to check it out. Holiday inn next door has a half decent bar. I am not sure if I would have stayed there with family.
review.negativeRemarks: room door, noise levels, free wifi in rooms
review.locationRemarks: Nicely connected

review.title: Spend the extra money and go elsewhere
review.reviewText: Room across from delivery warehouse very noisy all night long, old tv with no working selecter, and girl at front desk not very friendly. Did not feel very safe and would not recommend for a single lady. Good experience with airport shuttle, although this was run by a separate company. FYI...you cannot get in your room prior to the 3:00 time so if your plane gets in early, plan on sitting in a lobby.

review.title: Clean, cheap, you get what you pay for..
review.reviewText:
Positives: The room was appropriately clean, the staff was pleasent and always present. The hotel is located near a SAMTRANS bus stop (huge plus). On site coin washer/dryer. Hair dryer.

Negatives: The door to our room had a 1/4" gap which made for a loud evening with the windy SF Bay winds. The (pre) housekeeping staff walked in on us twice; once while we were sleeping. Small room or too much furniture, not sure, just wasn't enough walking room. No microwave, no mini fridge. Vending machines out of service. No wifi. The front gives the appearance of a sophicated well maintained upgraded enviornment and then you receive your key and walk to your room in the back to a shoddy two story building that you must slam your door to properly ensure its closed.
review.positiveRemarks: The room was appropriately clean, the staff was pleasent and always present. The hotel is located near a SAMTRANS bus stop (huge plus). Washer/dryer.
review.negativeRemarks: The doors to the rooms, the gaps in the doors, vending machine operable
review.locationRemarks: Near the bus stop, access to everything thru the bus system

review.title: A best value hotel!
review.reviewText: This a good hotel, not great due to a lot of things. For instance, I did not like the breakfast there because there was nothing and I also did not like the staffs there because of their terrible service. Anyway, I still recommend this hotel because it is not expensive.

review.title: CitiGarden Review
review.reviewText: The front desk was not courteous nor they were professional. other than that it is an okay place to stay.

review.title: Expedia Pricing
review.reviewText: The price of the room was well worh what I paid for it through the Expedia pricing - I saved about $40 a night and had what I would have had elsewhere. The contenintal breakfast was not worth it , and parking was tight , but otherwise it met my needs

review.title: Ok hotel just drafty
review.reviewText: Somewhat clean but too $ for the conditions and service
review.locationRemarks: South San Francisco went to the fishermans warf good Thia place on grand in South SanFrancisco

review.title: Nice hotel close to San Francisco,
review.reviewText:
Hotel was clean, rooms tasteful, staff was helpful.
Hotel comes with parking (no extra charge) and breakfast.
This was the third time we stayed there.
review.positiveRemarks: Spacious sunny courtyard. A room at the courtyard is quiet.
review.negativeRemarks: Look closely at the landscaping: pull weeds
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is located within 15 minutes of downtown San Francisco

review.title: Good hotel if you're flying out early the next day
review.reviewText: Good clean room. Excellent staff. Easy access to the airport.

review.title: Three day stay at Hotel with false promises.
review.reviewText: First of all GPS couldn't find hotel address and staff couldn't explain how to get their. I made it and check in was fine. I believe they didn't like the rate I got through Expedia so they wanted to send me way in the back. I talked the lady into rooming me next to the court yard. Got my room and started checking out other amenities the gym, below average, checked pool, ice cold.. So went to my room and tried to get on the internet since it was free with the room. But really it wasn't free with the room, I had to go to the lobby for free internet. So to the lobby I went. Woke up at 6 a.m. to go to a class and realized I had to wait till 6:30 for the free breakfast or even a cup of coffee. So I waited and about 6:20, 60 people showed up and it was a complete mad house to get a coffee, bowl of cereal and a muffin, terrible continental breakfast, way below average. Even though the price was good compared to other places close, I would pay $20 more a night close and get much better service. Never went back to breakfast and basically just stayed their as a place to sleep.

review.locationRemarks: Loud from the planes from 7 a.m. to 11:30 plus at night. San Francisco is always good to visit.

review.title: Close to airport

They charged my credit card $30 in case of any damage and no receipt as it was booked with expedia. No Fox news. Breakfast was OK, but limited and no one, other than me even left a tip.

review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast and room supplies.
review.locationRemarks: Can;t comment as I didn't visit anything other than a cemetery. Ate lunch and Dinner in SF.

review.title: disappointing experience

review.title: Good price

review.title: Cheap and adequate
review.reviewText: The breakfast was disappointing. No fresh fruit. The coffee was good, though.
review.positiveRemarks: It was close to where we needed to be.
review.negativeRemarks: Beds could be less firm. It was like sleeping on the ground. It was disappointing that the spa was shut down.

review.title: Save your money and stay elsewhere.

review.locationRemarks: Close to airport in a industrial area.

review.title: Decent hotel
review.reviewText: Nothing special. Free breakfast. Wish they offered free wifi
review.negativeRemarks: No wifi
review.locationRemarks: Quiet

review.title: Citigarden Surprise
review.reviewText: The Citigarden Hotel is an older hotel with great upgrades. The furnishings in my room might have come from a 4 star hotel. I had some trouble with the key card but the front desk took care of it right away. A barber shop and weight room are on the premises. The provided breakfast was limited to carbohydrates but the coffee was exceptional an service as well. I'll go back..
review.negativeRemarks: The exterior stairs with two suitcases.

review.title: Just okay
review.reviewText: Good value for the price, no fan in the restroom, not enough pillows in the room and not many freebies provided like lotion, soap etc. Again just ok for the value.

review.title: The first night was ok but the second was not.

We knew it would be loud with the airport but this was a little to much. The hotel was staff was very nice and helpful so that was good but the quests next to us made it not so pleasant. It was our secound time staying there but it will probly be our last.
review.negativeRemarks: Most everything. Needs a lot of upgrades.
review.locationRemarks: Right off of the freeway which was nice and near to resturants but wasn't worth the savings.

review.title: Disappointing
review.reviewText: The lobby and garden areas are very nice. The carpet in the room was dreadfully stained and really ruined the fact that the rest of the room - paint, furniture, cleanliness was fine. The bedding was clean but not very comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Room - especially carpet
review.locationRemarks: Very good for attending events at SSF Conference Center, near airport.

review.title: For the price - Go elsewhere.

Continental breakfast was very disappointing. For the price - Stay elsewhere. Beautiful lobby - but thats not representative of the rooms.
review.positiveRemarks: Beautiful lobby. Nice decor. Close to the airport. Free Airport shuttle.
review.negativeRemarks: Poor maintanance, Drafty room, Curtains don't completely cover the windows. Bad breakfast.

review.title: Excellent hotel, friendly staff

review.title: You get what you pay for
review.reviewText: Close to the airport, has airport shuttle which we really need, we parked our car for 5 days for $7 a day, not bad, has free breakfast and most of all, it is affordable esp if you will just stay for a night then fly. The only setback, the flushing water from upstairs woke me up in the morning. Although i really need to wake up early too for my flight.

review.title: Stay away from this hotel.
review.reviewText: I would never recommend this hotel. Hotel manager is a jerk.

review.title: It's OK.
review.reviewText: The only reason why I stayed was because it was close to the airport and the other hotels that are much closer and better (Marriott, Crowne plaza) are all booked. The hotel staff especially the Filipino woman was unprofessional and the only close place to eat is the Chinese buffet next door that are Chinese owned and very filthy and rude. Thre are no elevators so ve prepared to carry your suitcase. The bed was hard with small pillows. Ladies bring a conditioner unless your planning on not washing your hair.I will definitely not come back and will check out other hotels.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything.
review.locationRemarks: None

review.title: nice and pleasing hotel...Good and Basic!
review.reviewText:
I read all the reviews and the negative feedbacks about this hotel.
People need to realize, this isnt a 5 star hotel.....and it isnt as terrible as some picky users say.

Im a very very picky person as far hotel goes. This hotel was for the price,location the best choice....
its in a nice safe area, super close to the express way. Dennys is right across the street. Next to a fancy conference building.

The rooms are located outside, like everyone has their own private entry....the bed was comfy, a little bit on the firmer side, but comfy. Bathroom was decent...and it was always nice and quiet at night, didnt hear any neighbors. The TV was the old fashion tube tv, kinda small, but enough for me.
Hotel lobby is nice, with plenty of seats to relax and watch the news on the big screen tv.
WI FI is free in the lobby, but not in the room. Parking is free and plenty of space.
They had free breakfast, 7am - 9:30am, but I am not complaining...this isnt a 5 star hotel folks. So they had free coffee, free orange juices etc...toast, jelly, peanut butter, cereal, oatmeal, milk, tea fresh water...The basic to get your day started.
This hotel had everything I needed, i didnt expect too much...but i was very pleased.
I wish tho, the rooms had a little refrigerator.
So for 6 days, I was very pleased and comfortable staying at this Hotel and getting a nice sleep.

review.title: Surprisingly pleased
review.reviewText:
Having read a number of the not so great reviews, I arrived at the hotel with reservation. To my surprise, the hotel staff at the reception was friendly, welcoming, competent and very helpful.
The location is very convenient, and the free airport shuttle is a big plus.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly and helpful staff, clean room and good location
review.negativeRemarks: none
review.locationRemarks: Costco in walking distance

review.title: Okay hotel for the price
review.reviewText: Hotel is a bit close to the airport so it was a little noisy.

review.title: Cheap and gets the job done
review.reviewText: Just took a trip to San Francisco over the weekend. We were looking for a clean, safe, cheap hotel and found it at CityGarden. There's not a lot of bells and whistles with this hotel. But it's perfect if all you need is a place to lay your head at night. I would stay here again if visiting in the future.

review.title: You get what you pay for
review.reviewText: You get what you pay for. Try not to get the room next to the icemaker and soda machine, very noisy there. The price is good, and it's good if you need a place to sleep near the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: not a very good breakfast
review.locationRemarks: near the airport

review.title: You get what you pay for
review.reviewText: Outdated bedroom furniture and decor you see at your grandmother's house. Bathroom lock didn't work, and the bathroom itself was incredibly tiny. At least the heater worked.

review.title: Great place to hide.
review.reviewText:
No scheduled wake up call. Dated appearance . Cold rooms. Noisy location next to Fwy.
Dreadful hot food buffet. Overpriced too. Room prices ok.
review.negativeRemarks: Food
review.locationRemarks: Noisy

review.title: Basic, clean cheap room near SFO
review.reviewText:
Pros- Cheap and close to SFO Room was clean.
Cons- Doors and locks did not give me a strong sense of security. This is a very 'basic' property down to the sheets, towels, soap, breakfast, dcor. etc.
I needed a place to crash for the night and they had the lowest price.
review.negativeRemarks: Very basic
review.locationRemarks: 2 miles from SFO with free shuttle

review.title: I SPEAK TRUTH!
review.reviewText: This is a great Hotel to save some money instead of staying in downtown SF, however the room I stayed in had no microwave, coffee pot and the TV's are seriously a joke, 19". The rooms are clean but bring your own pillow, this is very important! The free breakfast is waffles, toast, bagels and cereal which is just a teaser for my appetite. My body requires meat, oh yeah! There is a cool barber shop in the hotel, a pool, restaurant and a little room with some workout machines which I did not partake of, maybe next time. I can't complain for $70 for 2 queen beds sleeping 4 people, but just giving the facts. When checking in the staff was not delightful, to say the least. When the keys were given to me for the room she just turned around and I thought to myself, "Ok, I guess we are done here". No, "Have a nice stay", or "Thanks for choosing us". Nothing. The money you save on the room, give a tip to the gals that clean the rooms, they were the only staff that was nice and friendly, and I don't even speak their language. Cheers!
review.negativeRemarks: BREAKFAST
review.locationRemarks: 25 MIN. FROM DOWNTOWN

review.title: Inexpensive bleak hotel
review.reviewText:
I was in a bind unable to fly out due to weather.
This hotel was recommended by Customer Service at Airport.
Staff was friendly.
Hotel was bleak and room was bleak.
Appeared clean in dull light, missing light bulb in one lamp.
Sheets were clean.
Bedspread was iffy and the one blanket was skimpy.
I would not stay here again.

review.title: Family

review.title: Location is Good

review.title: Poor inviting front desk
review.reviewText: After we made reserved room by expedia , drove there an hour later to check in ... It was sad experience we had . When I got to at hotel desk she said does not have reserve confirmation .. she asked me when did you reserve ? .. she checked file and find it . there nobody there at time . I felt uninvited feeling with no smile ! they are busy for eccentric business and child was playing with computer ...when I got room that was wrong room , we need two bed not one bed ..so then again I had to back desk ... There was no apologie from her . I never stay there again !

review.title: DO NOT STAY HERE!! SERVICE DREADFUL!!
review.reviewText:
My experience was awful to say the least. I booked this hotel because it offered a complimentary shuttle to and from the airport. I called the hotel and asked if I had to make a reservation for the shuttle - I was told no and that I would be able to identify the shuttle as it had the name CITIGARDEN on it. I explained to the lady who answered the phone that my flight was arriving in San Francisco at 11:45pm. She said that the last shuttle leaves at 12:41am. I get there at 12:20pm and wait in the cold. All the shuttles were for all the other hotels. At 12:43am I make my first call to this hotel. I told the night clerk I was at the airport waiting for the shuttle. He told me that the last shuttle leaves at 12:48am. At 12:49am, I call the hotel again. He tells me that the shuttle will leave at 12:51am. Still no shuttle and I'm now the only person standing in the freezing cold waiting for a shuttle. I call back the hotel several times before the night auditor answered. When I asked about the shuttle he said that it would leave at 12:58am! At this point I lost my patience with him. I asked him why had he told me 3 different departure times and pointed out to him that it was 1:01am! There was no shuttle! When I called him back he told me that the shuttle driver just arrived and handed him the keys to the shuttle. He then told me that the shuttle driver told him that he saw me waiting at the airport!!
At CitiGarden at 2:05am, the night auditor took over 25 minutes to check me in!!
review.negativeRemarks: The lack of customer service.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the airport.

review.title: Good for travelers with trucks
review.reviewText: Worst continental breakfast in three USA, trerrible TV
review.locationRemarks: Great access

review.title: Best value

I like this hotel very much. There is a nice lobby and yard. Especially the room is comfy with fresh air. I have been staying in this hotel for a month. Every moring I open drapery, warm sun get into my room, I sit at sofa read my bookfeels like at home.
House keeper do very good job, so my room is very clean.

If they have free wi-fi in room, I would like stay here again.
review.locationRemarks: S san Francisco blvd, it is only few minutes away to SFO.

review.title: Great overnight for airport
review.reviewText: We needed a cheap clean place to spend the night near airport. Free shuttle, continental breakfast and clean room fit the bill.

review.title: As nice as you'll find in San Francisco for the $$
review.reviewText: We stay in San Francisco numerous times a year. We find this hotel neater, more reasonable than any within miles . The room is perfect for us, furnished very nicely, and my wake up call is always right on time. They have a minimal continental breakfast, but, the room price , offsets that. I would always check with this hotel for availability, before any other.
review.positiveRemarks: Room was decorated very well for as low priced as it was.
review.negativeRemarks: Snotty desk clerk, on our last stay.
review.locationRemarks: As close to the freeway and access to restaurants as you could ask.

review.title: The worst hotel I ever stayed
review.reviewText: The knob of the shower was broken. We did not have hot water. We called for repair and nobody came not until the last night of our stay where they have to let us transfer to another room. Breakfast was really bad.. old pancakes.. coffe taste awful. We have to ask for towels .There were a lot of garbage by the parking lot of old and dirty sheets . It was a sore to the eyes. Will not go back .

review.title: Budget stay
review.reviewText: Inexpensive! This is as no frills as you get. Free wi-fi in the lobby is a plus, but there is no coverage for many of the rooms. It feels like a larger hostel for this reason. Near the airport is a plus.

review.title: Its a ok hotel
review.reviewText: Breakfast needs improvement.Nothing more.This is highly ridiculous to force user to write more than he intends to

review.title: The hotel with a potential

review.negativeRemarks: The check in and check out time.

review.title: Not recommend
review.reviewText:
We have always use Expedia in our travel plan. Your web site is usually trust worthy and reliable, but with this Citi Garden hotel, you have missed the mark Big time.
The hotel was filthy and old, inside and outside. Our parking lot was next to the big pile of garbage and renovation scrabs it was smelly and very unsanitation.
The room was dirty and loud.
We were exhausted from driving all day, and did not want to drive any more.
I didn't sleep at all, left early in the moring at 4 am.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Airport

review.title: Great hotel, great experience
review.reviewText: This is my second time staying at the CitiGarden Hotel. I was pleased with the service and the room. They gave me a room towards the back end of the hotel, which was fine. There was some remodeling going on in the rear building of the hotel, across the parking lot from my room. I didn't mind as I was only staying one night. As far as the room, it was clean and well-kept. Bed was comfortable, the shower and bath were clean, and with plenty of hot water. I slept pretty well on that bed for only getting four hours of sleep. They had a free breakfast just off the hotel lobby, and it looked pretty good, but I didn't have time to enjoy it. Only thing I found wrong was that the pool was not clean, but it is South San Francisco in February, and it was really cold that night. I'm sure it will be cleaned by summer time. Overall, great stay at the hotel, again. I'll definitely stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: Bed, shower, room, free breakfast, service.
review.negativeRemarks: Remodeling of the rear building of the hotel. Furniture piled in parking lot where I parked.
review.locationRemarks: Great location. Within 5 minutes of SFO, 10 mins to San Francisco, just off two important freeways.

review.title: Good for the price
review.reviewText: It was basic but clean and the staff is friendly. The price and what I get are well worth it

review.title: Great place for the price!
review.reviewText: I thought the lobby was absolutly beautiful and the continential breakfast was very good! I was pleased with the rooms, however, could use updating on the carpets; I could see everything else was being updated as there were piles and piles of old furniture around the property. TV's could use some updating as well and I am sure they will get to all of these other updates. Very nice staff as well. We stayed on the outside of the hotel and it was a bit noisy but the garden view did not have as much noise as that is where my daughter sayed.
review.locationRemarks: A little busy for quite.

review.title: Some good news and some bad news
review.reviewText: Initially, I was very concerned about the "looks" of the grounds when I drove back to find my room. The back section had been gutted and furniture is piled up outside and it really looks frightening. I also saw a couple strange characters back in the corridors of the dark area and I was headed back to the lobby to insist on a room change. Once directed correctly to my building, I found it easily and the room wasn't that bad. The only eyesore is the threadbare carpeting. Otherwise, it was very presentable and very clean. Breakfast was decent and the opportunity of leaving my car two extra days plus an airport shuttle made for a very convenient arrangement. This place fit my budget and satisfied my needs. It definitely needs some cosmetic improvements while renovations are happening.
review.negativeRemarks: the furniture piled outside
review.locationRemarks: very convenient for the airport

review.title: Bates Motel
review.reviewText: Took 12 hours to get towels. Trash on floor upon arrival. Trash everywhere outside. Breakfast horrible.

review.title: Good hotel for traveler using SFO
review.reviewText:
This hotel is very good for traveler.
The price is very low. The room is very clean and very quiet.
But wifi is only in the loby. In the room the price was needed.
In the next time, I will stay in ths hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: The staff is the first step for theie jop, the processing time was very long.

review.title: Great place to stay for the price

review.title: Disappointing

review.title: Good hotel for a family

review.title: Poor and old room facilities

Otherwise the hotel was ok.

review.negativeRemarks: Only one washcloth in room.

review.title: this hotel is okay!

review.title: Would stay there again

review.title: OK hotel for Stay, Park and Fly.

NOT explicit about having to pay extra.
Otherwise hotel OK for the night, shuttle service was good, but no Breakfast by the 4:14 AM shuttle time, Looks like they were just setting up to make the 4:44 shuttle time.
John
review.negativeRemarks:
Fan in room would wake up entire building, falling apart.

review.locationRemarks: Very good

review.title: A Terrible Experience fist night at San Francisco
review.reviewText:
They claimed you can use WiFi free at the lobby, but they either lied or they did not train their staff well.

The staff tried two hours and can't get either my son's phone nor his computer connected. Then they blamed the phone because my son was using Android. The staff showed me that his iPhone worked, so I let him try my iPhone, which was a ridicules excuse. The result was obvious: it was not connected.

The last effort the staff made was telling me to go to the TV room which was 30 second walking distance from the lobby, because he saw someone was using internet there and the signal would be stronger since the station was closer to the TV room. The truth was the person was watching the TV not surfing the internet and of course we were still not connected.

It told me that the hotel lied, the staff did not know what they were doing, and they tried very hard to find excuses for themselves, not solutions for the customer.
review.negativeRemarks: Customer service and food.
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco, CA

review.title: Good hotel good price
review.reviewText: Great location, especially if you are going to the Niner game...Breakfast was totally disappointing. Juice, coffee, bagels, cereal, not really what I would consider a continental breakfast. Also, they don't offer free wi-fi service, $6.99 per day just isn't worth it.

review.title: Ok

review.title: Don't stay here!

I put my bags and things on the tables to avoid them touching the floor. I did not shower in the room. I closed the curtains out of fear of getting robbed. I spent time trying to figure out if there was a way to not sleep in the bed for fear of bedbugs.
review.negativeRemarks: Don't stay here unless your only other option is a bench in the park.

breakfast was crummy.

The bed had eight to ten inch wells on the left and right sides, with a ridge running down the middle. It was the most uncomfortable bed I have ever in my life slept on. review.title: Economical Hotel

review.title: Great hotel if you want to cut costs!

review.title: Not Recommended

review.title: Nice for the price.
review.reviewText: Pretty nice for the price. Also a free airport shuttle
review.locationRemarks: Good location if your flying.

review.title: A trip to San Francisco
review.reviewText: Friendly stuff, close to San francisco, comfortable for couples but not very romantic

review.title: Nice hotel for a low price.
review.reviewText: The hotel is nice for the low price I paid. Lobby is nice. I had a room that faced the garden, which is way better than facing the parking lot. The building shares space with the Beijing buffet, so you smell their food often when you are outside. the continental breakfast is great. lots of food available- waffles, pancakes, toast, cereals, O.J, milk, cream cheese. Beds are alright, bathroom is clean. Overall a good experience, only a few minutes from Candlestick Park if you plan to go to a 49ers game.
review.positiveRemarks: Close proximity to Candlestick and fisherman's wharf
review.negativeRemarks: Had to pay $20 more each night for an extra bed.
review.locationRemarks: lots of hotels in the area. near the airport

review.title: AN EXCELLENT HOTEL
review.reviewText: EVERYTHING WAS EXCELLENT!!! I WOULD STAY AT THIS HOTEL AGAIN!

review.title: good cost benefit
review.reviewText: Good location. Good deal for the price. Easy access to san Francisco downtown and the silicon valley.

review.title: Avoid if you can
review.reviewText: this is a tired, marginal hotel. the only thing going for it is its proximity to SFO

review.title: Average at best
review.reviewText:
Hotel is very far away from the city and buses can take up to 2 hours to get there. It doesn't feel safe at night so I do not reccommend for any single female travelers. It is limited for food.

Good airport shuttle service and some friendly service. Would reccommend only for business men as it is close to the airport.
review.locationRemarks: Inconvinient for the city!

review.title: good hotel for people with early flights from SFO
review.reviewText: Generally the experience was good, but I didn't appreciate the extra charges for internet, and an additional extra charge to use the business center to print a boarding pass. While the complimentary breakfast was good, I was surprised that there was no in-room coffeemaker, haven't stayed at many places that lacked one.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfortable quiet room despite proximity to the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: A bit overpriced, considering the amenites that were missing or cost extra.
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient to SFO

review.title: Perfect transit hotel for Incheon
review.reviewText: Pick up from Incheon airport was very quick and efficient. Hotel is in a quiet area within 5 minutes stroll of the waterside - there's a bit of sand, and lots of fish restaurants. This is not a place you'd come for a holiday, but as a transit hotel for a night or two in Incheon it works very well.
review.positiveRemarks: Efficient, free pick up at the airport
review.negativeRemarks: Took a while to get the wifi working

review.title: Adequate and convenient hotel
review.reviewText:
Hotel lobby was very nice, but hotel is older 2 story motel with parking outside door. Rooms had new and very nice furnishings. The parking lot, of course, was noisy with people coming and going since it is very close to SF airport. The shuttle was very convenient and on time.
We did not get to breakfast until 9:20, knowing that it stopped serving at 9:30. There was very little food available, not sure what was in all the empty containers, but there was only cereal and not enough milk, toast, coffee and juices. I found waffles behind the counter that had already been taken up, so not sure if food was gone or taken away. The person cleaning up asked about 10 of us to leave at 9:40 saying she was supposed to close at 9:30, might say they need to change their hours for serving if they really want to close doors at 9:30.
Overall, the stay was fine, but the price was too much for what we got!
review.negativeRemarks: continental breakfast and noisy parking lot
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient to SFO airport

review.title: Fine for one night
review.reviewText: Basic motel. Nothing fancy, not pretty, but clean and close to the airport. Fine for a one night stay when traveling to/from SFO, but I wouldn't stay longer because the area is unappealing and the hotel is not attractive.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff is really trying hard: nice towels and bed linens, new mattresses, very clean, and staff was friendly and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Unattractive hotel and unattractive location.
review.locationRemarks: Industrial, close to the airport. Very convenient for flights.

review.title: Mediocre for that rate
review.reviewText: Mediocre for that rate. Room was Noisy and cheap uncofortable pillows. Breakfast was a joke.

review.title: In a pinch
review.reviewText: In a pinch it's manageable but know its a pretty grungy place.

review.title: nice stay
review.reviewText: loby is really nice and then the rooms look more like a motel

review.title: Citigarden clean and comfy, good for the money.
review.reviewText: Very clean room, the Indian woman at the front desk was not very friendly, pillows were thin, towels were thick, small tv with interference from planes(?), buffet adjoining hotel was awesome (snow crab legs were yummy, clams were excellent as well as boiled shrimp), overall a good experience ( not the same hotel I had read about in previous reviews). Very convenient location.

review.title: Cheap Hotel if stuck at SFO
review.reviewText: Good for a cheap spot if you're stuck at SFO for the night. Easy to get to the airport.

review.title: Acceptable.
review.reviewText: It was acceptable for budget conscious people. It was nice and drama free but old style and not up to date in technology.
review.negativeRemarks: Costly internet, no fridge, no microwave, old TV, Stained carpet, cold staff.

review.title: good hotel for everyone.
review.reviewText: this hotel was pleasant but the bed was a bit hard. place was quiet considering it is by the airport. breakfast could have been better, didn't have any bagels because the order hadn't arrived & the fruit was out of a can.
review.negativeRemarks: th bed was a bit hard.
review.locationRemarks: easy to find.

review.title: Just say NO!
review.reviewText:
Pay attention to the reviews here! We only stayed one night and chose this hotel for the park-n-fly availability. It's old, run-down (although there is some up-dating going on), and just has a general unsafe feel, The 'gap under the door' proved to be true in our room. The staff was unfriendly and unhelpful.

One nice thing: our car proved to be safe upon our return!

review.title: It's value for money.
review.reviewText:
If it's nice and cheap hotel.
Not far from downtown San Francisco and if you drive, it's a good choice.

review.title: I won't go there any more!
review.reviewText:
I spend three hours to check in!
When I slept in my room,The assistant
of the front door knocked my door rudely.Because they got the wrong name when I check in.
This is the worst service that I have never seen!
The funiture is old and the carpet is a little dirty.
But the breakfast is good in this place.

review.title: Disappointing
review.reviewText: When I booked a double room for my son and I, paying more for two beds than for a room with one king-sized bed. However, when we arrived we were given a room with a single king-sized bed. I called the front desk and was told there were no rooms available with two beds and they would send us a roll-away. It was late and we were very tired, but we waited at least a half hour for the bed. I finally called the front desk and was told they didn't have any available. They never had the courtesy to let us know so we waited and stayed up later than we wanted to. Also, the continental breakfast left a lot to be desired. There was only carbohydrate-laden foods... no fruit or yogurt or granola... no croissants or rolls.... just plain bread, toaster waffles and toaster pancakes, and cold cereal. Also, no coffee-maker in the room.
review.negativeRemarks: The service and the breakfast

review.title: Unpleasant stay
review.reviewText: No elevator access to 2nd floor; difficult with luggage. Front counter personnel not very friendly. Room a little run-down. TV remote and console controls not functional. Breakfast was a chaotic, hectic, and disorganized event; food was everywhere and it seemed very unsanitary.

review.title: OK but drab.
review.reviewText: I was looking forward to the first morning for the continental breakfast. What a disappointment! They had an open jar of peanut butter, a basket of wheat bread, four selections of cereal and some bagels. Talk about cheapo!
review.negativeRemarks: Drab room
review.locationRemarks: Good location, next to freeway entrance, Hwy 101

review.title: ok hotel
review.reviewText: The rooms are non smoking clean though anybody can see that the carpet in our room and on some corridors that we passed need to be changed. The staff were friendly and the breakfast was good. Good for its price.
review.negativeRemarks: carpet.

review.title: This is a Motel
review.reviewText: This is a MOTEL. If you drive up to the room door, that is not a Hotel.

review.title: You get what you pay for.
review.reviewText: It was clean, and we got what we paid for. Bed was a bit hard and small, but overall it was fine. I will fork out a bit more next time and be closer to the city. This was near mostly industrial areas.

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText: The carpet was dirty, room smelled musty, TV remote didn't work, no free WiFi available, no coffee in room. Drinking water no easily accessible.
review.positiveRemarks: Location to airport, shopping and restaurants was good. Parking close to room was good.
review.negativeRemarks: Dirty carpets, TV remote didint work, no free WiFi
review.locationRemarks: Excellent!

review.title: Great cheap stay after a long day
review.reviewText:
for being a two star hotel, I was surprised at how roomy it was. Our beds were fairly comfortable and clean (besides the sloppy job they did on our beds during our second night.) The lobby is very nice and breakfast was decent. Parking was free and plentiful. Very comfortable stay to go to after a long day in the city.

And the showerhead was amazing.
review.negativeRemarks: upkeep of room
review.locationRemarks: about a mile away from a major shopping center, gas across the street, very close to airport and about a 20 min drive to downtown sf

review.title: "Don't stay in this hotel"
review.reviewText: Completely disaster......after having fun in San Francisco you just want to get into a nice room, and what we got was a room where the outside air could pass under the door, the door needed to be push/pull so hard to open or close it; the door lock seems like its going to stay in your hand after closing the door. Very very old furnitures, just because I didn't check the rooms before checking in I stayed in it. But definetely for the money I could have stayed on a much much better place.

review.title: Great choice for a flight-connection-night
review.reviewText:
the motel is located to the north of SFO airport. its location is ideal for those who need to spend a night for flight connection, but not more than that. we booked it for 2 adults and 1 nine years old child. we were given a 'Queen' bed size (hardly enough for two).
there was no coffee maker in the room.
we were given a room at the 2nd floor (ground fl is 1 in USA) but there was no lift.
the breakfast room has no windows so we had to sit in the lounge.
there is a shuttle to SFO airport but on a very special day it did not turn up at the airport and we had to take a taxi.
we stayed for 4 nights and although there is a free shuttle to SFO to take the BART, the latter one journey ticket was $8.25 each way.
review.positiveRemarks: to consider for a single night stay
review.negativeRemarks: bed size
review.locationRemarks: ideal for a flight connection or arriving late at night

review.title: Unfortunate stay at City Garden.
review.reviewText: The room was dirty and outdated. The kind of dirty where you don't want to take your shoes off and wear your flip-flop's in the shower. I could have had a cleaner and cheaper room if I would have just stayed in a Motel 6. (never again)

review.title: Reasonable cost, but...
review.reviewText: Dried food on the chair, carpet in serious need of cleaning
review.positiveRemarks: Close to other facilities with food and drink
review.negativeRemarks: cleanliness
review.locationRemarks: close to SFO and has airport shuttle

review.title: RELAX
review.reviewText: NICE CLOSE TO SFO ,CITY, FOOD,NICE OUTSIDE PLAZA, FREE BREAKFAST WASS OK

review.title: Not worthfir
review.reviewText:
Very basic,

Room smelled funny.
TV was very old.
BAthroom was dirty. Found hairs on the toilet.
There was no soap.
review.positiveRemarks: That I did not have to stay long
review.negativeRemarks: People were a little scary in the area
review.locationRemarks: close to the highway and airport. Good

review.title: Beware
review.reviewText: We use a park & ride hotel at SF often, its a great deal & makes for a better trip. This place is our absolute last choice. While the rooms are OK the staff has always been very rude and they always have a hidden charge. This time it was $55 for not saying I wanted Park & Ride when I made the reservation. Everyone we talked to had there own story, other hidden charges, & felt the same. Its better than nothing but not by much. If everything gos alright it will be OK, if you have a problem, look out and don't expect them to care. You can pay more at a better place, not have to deal with them, and it will still wind up costing less!
review.negativeRemarks: Very rude staff

review.title: Will not return
review.reviewText:
Front desk staff rude and incompetent when confronted with their mistake of charging us twice for our stay. Would have never considered staying in this hotel, but really had no choice with our last-minute travel plans. It also happened to be the busiest travel days in July, and very few other SFO hotels had vacancy.

Hotel itself is dated, though partially renovated. Our room was reasonably clean and comfortable. Very concerned about bed bugs in this hotel, but think we lucked out.

Will not stay in this hotel again.
review.negativeRemarks: Front desk staff and manager

review.title: Very clean room
review.reviewText: It was my 2nd stay in this hotel. I think they offer the best for the price. The room is very clean and nice, I think that is the most important. Thank you
review.locationRemarks: Very close to the airport

review.title: Dated
review.reviewText:
Hotel was an older property (exterior entrances - 70's construction) and dated, but clean. rooms did not fit the pictures on the web site and not many amenities.

Close to the airport. Not bad to spend the night. Not a vacation choice.

review.title: Discourteous staff
review.reviewText: Discourteous staff from front desk, breakfast attendants to house cleaning. No one greets even when greeted first. In a separate incident I asked access to a microwave(there should have been one in the room to begin with) to sanitize my syringes. I was told if they "there are 300 rooms how could they supply microwaves to every room? Why don't I take a container to the kitchen, I could get as much boiling water I could" and hung up on .... the next morning I saw a microwave in the breakfast room. i learned it was always there. So i think they could have offered to let me use that microwave, instead i had to go to a local hospital to take my injections....
review.positiveRemarks: The location is great and portions of the garden are really beautiful
review.negativeRemarks: Staff behavior and smell from the restaurant kitchen
review.locationRemarks: Hotel is conveniently located from the airport and major highway exits.

review.title: Nice place to stay
review.reviewText: Hotel was what was expected for the price. The pool is outdoors which wasn't advertised. I liked the continental breakfast and friendly staff

review.title: Noisy warehouse next door
review.reviewText: My only real complaint is on one side of the hotel is a warehouse that works ALL night long. We had to be at the airport at 445 the next morning and neither one of us slept a wink because of the forklifts backing up and dropping pallets all night. Other than that the hotel was okay for the price and closeness to SFO.

review.title: Shabby, noisy...but with cheap parking.
review.reviewText: The room was large, but dated, despite the bathroom remodel. The noise level was ridiculously loud. It seemed all the folks that were flying out and not staying long term were put in the lower level of the hotel facing the garden area. The number of people rolling in with their luggage throughout the night kept me up all night. The windows in the room are NOT dual-paned making the noise factor intolerable. On the positive side, the parking was very reasonable($40/10 days). I would not stay here again, unless I was desperate...in retrospect, it would have been worth the price to pay for parking and stay elsewhere.
review.positiveRemarks: Parking was cheap and not too far from the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise and breakfast...oh, and no iron in the room.
review.locationRemarks: Near Airport location.

review.title: Close to SFO - Price Is Right
review.reviewText: For a one or two night stay the price is right and the property is OK. It is an older property so don't expect the Grand Hyatt.

review.title: Maybe not for the single female traveler.
review.reviewText:
It's hard to convey my real reactions to it based on the rating categories given. The room was reasonably clean. The caulk around the tub could have used an extra hit of bleach. It looked okay and I can't honestly say it was bad - but it didn't feel great. It was a little damp. The rug could have used a change about ten years ago. There was a decided draft under the door. The bed seemed clean. The bathroom (apart from the caulk) seemed clean. In short, it may have been sparkling clean, but it wasn't the sort of clean I trusted implicitly (I pulled everything off the bed to check for bugs first - not something I do everyplace I stay).
It's a courtyard hotel so most (if not all) room doors are outside. For those of us who are security conscious, that gave me the willies. I guess I didn't realize how creepy it would feel when I booked. I was glad for the triple lock on the door (handle, chain and deadbolt).
It's super convenient to the airport though and about $70 to $100 cheaper than it's neighbors so in light of that, not bad I guess. Check-in and check-out were fine with no problems.
review.positiveRemarks: Price and proximity to the airport
review.negativeRemarks: General room "feel"
review.locationRemarks: Extremely convenient, no real "neighborhood" to speak of - it's on a street with a whole lot of other hotels and airport services.

review.title: good price and location to airport!
review.reviewText: It was worth what we paid for it, small fitness center but it had what I needed. It was close and easy to get to and from the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: room smelled a little

review.title: Had a good stay
review.reviewText: The room smelled good, bathroom looked brand new or recently remodeled but outdated furnitures and the carpet was disappointing. Beds were comfortable, I had a good sleep.was 15 minutes away from the fisherman warf which wasn't a problem at all, we were there in July and there was no traffic. The breakfast wasn't realy anything( not hot breakfast). No free Internet u have to pay $7 per 24 hours. Over all it was good for the price, all I needed a clean bathroom and bed and we had that. Staff were helpful about printing out the direction for us since we did not have Internet connection. No refrigerator.
review.negativeRemarks: The carpet and the furniture
review.locationRemarks: Not to far from golden gate

review.title: Simple hotel but can be better
review.reviewText:
No free internet
Simple things like microwave, fridge is not available easily. You may have to pay for them.
They can certainly learn a lot from the nearby hotels which are smaller in size but has better facilities.
Breakfast was good :)

review.title: penny pinching hotel
review.reviewText: we request for a pillow it never came, my 3x,waited for two hours never came my husband has to pick it up on frontdesk,her reason too busy, breakfast terrible service or no service at all,if you ask something the server a little old lady has attitude ,look too overwhelmed ,evrything is penny pinching,not coming back at all and not recommenden at all
review.negativeRemarks: service,room
review.locationRemarks: 30 minuter downtow s.f

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText: Room was good. They charge you for a roll away bed even though it says they dont charge. Breakfast wasnt the best but cant complain about free food. Overall it was fine. Rooms arent that fancy but the hotel is nice.

review.title: One of our worst hotel experience
review.reviewText:
We spent 12 days vacation in different hotels in California, this one was the worst.
Not being really cheap for a 2 bed room , not even queen bed, there was no refrigerator or microwave in the rooms. Even when we wanted to get a hot drink, tee or coffee, no brewer in the room or in the hotel. We were asked to walk or drive to the next Starbuck 3/4 mile away.
As well as internet connection, we had to pay 7$ and the speed was so slow we could only use our emails.
On the morning, the breakfeast is just the minimum politicaly correct to say there is a free breakfeast, poor and not good.

If you add the cost of wifi, to take a coffee to the price, the other hotels arround are cheaper.
review.negativeRemarks: Too lng list for th space, read my comments
review.locationRemarks: Convenient near the airport

review.title: Average Hotel for a Budget
review.reviewText:
Overall not too bad, especially for the price. Slept well the three nights we stayed. Staff was always polite and helpful when asked. Free breakfast.

Unfortunately...

Maids did not do anything to the room while we were gone during the day, even though the sign said "Please clean room". Our bed wasn't made, no clean towels provided, no new soap, nada. Breakfast is nothing to get excited about, mostly microwave items and cereal.
review.negativeRemarks: Room service.
review.locationRemarks: Easy to find, safe area.

review.title: OK
review.reviewText: OK place to stay if you're looking for a cheap hotel near SFO airport.
review.negativeRemarks: Looks like a motel

review.title: Great Hotel for a Single Guest.
review.reviewText:
I enjoyed my stay at the hotel. The room was very clean and the maid knocked on my door after my arrival to give me more towels without me asking for them. It is a great place to stay for overnight or for two days.

It had a swimming pool but it was too chilly outside to go in it. They provided a continental breakfast which was nice. The guests seem to enjoy it. The staff is very friendly and accomodating. The shuttle was quick to and from the hotel. They have a business office but no one was in it. I guess because you have to use a credit card ($3.00) to use the internet. They also have a small health club. I would have gone in there but the down was locked and I was too tired to ask to use it. Down the street is a IHOP, if you do not want to use the restaurants they recommend with those menus in the room.

Public transportation (bus) is just a few doors from the hotel. It was very accomodating for going downtown San Francisco. the bus drivers were very nice, too.

As a woman traveling alone, I felt safe in the room and the hotel has a pleasant atmosphere.
review.positiveRemarks: It was clean and the staff was friendly and accomodating.
review.negativeRemarks: I would say more options in the business center. There was only a computer but nothing else.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is much closer to the airport than I expected. The staff said about 30 minutes from it, but actually it was only 12 minutes.

review.title: review of City Garden Hotel -- TERRIBLE
review.reviewText:
This hotel has an inner courtyard which is very nice -- for the summer. Unfortunately the outer courtyard on the south side is next to an industrial area and I was awakened by a garbage truck at 4am !! The soundproofing of the room was terrible. I should never have accepted a room in the outer area as I am a light sleeper and I had forgotten my earplugs. The room was not very clean and the mattress on the bed was the worst I have ever experienced.

This was not good value for the price charged. Thank goodness it was only for 1 night. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone.
review.negativeRemarks: noise level and mattress
review.locationRemarks: outer courtyard room

review.title: Great hotel to relax
review.reviewText: The decor was beautiful. Has big windows to let in the sunshine.The bed was just right.

review.title: OK hotel
review.reviewText: The Hotel lobby decor was very nice. The rooms were a bit dated and the you could hear a lot of outside noise through the door that had some gaps and a draft coming through. It was nice enough for what I needed and was in a good location for several business meetings I had. While the room was dated it was clean. Checking in was OK.
