I saw 2 or 3 people working the desk but only 1 person was doing the check ins and check outs which took me a bit longer than I would have liked. It would have been great it someone could have seen that the line had grown and offered to help. I would recommend this hotel only if you are in need of a room to only sleep in and do not want to pay a lot of money for it.
review.positiveRemarks: lobby decor and cleanliness of room
review.negativeRemarks: outdated room, and that it was more like a motel withn the door on the outside of the hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Great for my meetings

review.title: Good for budget. Better to stay in the City.
review.reviewText: I would only recomend for a budget conscious way to visit SF.
review.positiveRemarks: It was OK for the price. But you get what you pay for.
review.locationRemarks: Ok location if you know enough about how to get to the City and get your self around.

review.title: Citi Garden
review.reviewText: ok for a place to sleep. Decent breakfast. Close to freeway.

review.title: Expedia shouldnt put their name to this hotel
review.reviewText:
Hotel staff were mixed some were ok and some were absolutely terrible, after coming back from dinner we found a repair guy in our room?!? I mean whats that about?!?

There is nothing to do around the hotel except for the See's Candy outlet store, best bet for cheap eats is takeaways as the surrounding options are either the hotels very dirty looking Chinese buffet, very expensive Hungry Hunters/ Houligans and McDondales.

Definitely would never stay there again.

review.title: Good Hotel for the Price, thumbs up.
review.reviewText: My boyfriend and I decided to save money and stayed here outside San Francisco. Not the best looking hotel but pretty decent and worth the money!
review.locationRemarks: Close to the airport

review.title: Fair value for ur money
review.reviewText: No free internet. Howver they do offer free parking and complemetary breakfast.

review.title: Okay for the price I guess
review.reviewText: Compared to other hotels in the area, the price was cheaper. The rooms were clean and the staff was fairly helpful. The breakfast was not great- bread, bagels, prepackaged pancakes/waffles, cereal, and nasty looking canned fruit. The breakfast room was always super crowded. The walls to the bedrooms were super thin and I could hear everything going on outside and in surrounding rooms (I knew when other people were taking showers/going to the bathroom!) The bed wasn't that comfortable, but it was okay I guess. It was always too cold to use the pool and we were there in late June. There is nothing to do in walking distance. The buffet next door was good though.
review.positiveRemarks: Price compared to other hotels in the area.
review.negativeRemarks: The thickness of the walls, the area, the bed.
review.locationRemarks: Nothing around but hotels/motels, a few food places, and a Costco.

review.title: Good place to stay
review.reviewText: Hotel was clean, quite and convieniently located close to the freeway and restaurants. Great place to stay.

review.title: Don't go....
review.reviewText: Reservation desk customer service was bad and I won't recommend or come back there.
review.negativeRemarks: customer service
review.locationRemarks: Have to go back to SFO, but will find a different hotel to stay at.

review.title: Great deal, not luxurious.
review.reviewText: Stayed Wed. through Sat. for the U.S. Open at The Olympic Club. Great access to SFO and public transportation. A great deal for those not needing luxury accommodations and just need a place to sleep and clean up. Wouldn't stay here with my wife and daughter in tow, but was perfect for my father and I, who aren't too concerned that the room be upscale. Free breakfast was not great, but it was free. Would stay here again as long as it's just the boys.
review.negativeRemarks: Dated
review.locationRemarks: Great location, close to SFO, Caltrain, BART

review.title: Location, location, location!
review.reviewText: You get what you pay for. I was using the hotel to be close to the airport which it was. There is no view except other hotels. It served its purpose and it is what I was expecting. Not disappointed.
review.negativeRemarks: A group came in about 3:30 a.m. and were outside and loud untl about 5 a.m.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the airport.

review.title: Travel convenience
review.reviewText:
We have stayed here three times and are pleased with the hotel for the price paid, and for the tremendous convenience of parking our car for a week or two, as well as the shuttle to and from the airport.

A breakfast is offered but since we have always left early, have never been able to take advantage of it. Would be nice if they would at least serve coffee and sweet rolls in the very large lobby for those of us who must leave before breakfast since food no longer served on the plane.
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: Convenient to the San Francisco airport

review.title: Gross
review.reviewText: There are boarded up rooms in the section of the hotel we stayed in. This is a motel, and a low quality one.
review.locationRemarks: Seems convenient, but still a $15 cab ride to it (late night flight= no shuttle)

review.title: Nice older room
review.reviewText: For an average motel it was good. I would stay there again. The lobby was beautiful. The rooms were clean and nice. It was an older hotel. The one thing that bothered me was the lack of lighting. I have low vision and especially in dim lighting it is very hard to see. At night, in the room, it was hard to get around. There were no overhead light just lamps in the corners that gave limited lighting.
review.negativeRemarks: Dim lighting
review.locationRemarks: Good location; easay to find

review.title: A bit displeased
review.reviewText: Looks more like a Motel. Beds are small, you hear noise in the room and have no clue where its coming from. For one night it was ok but I would not stay there more than one night.
review.negativeRemarks: Queen size bed sucks, not comfortable

review.title: Cheap and ok, hotel has seen better days.
review.reviewText: Cheap hotel, ok for a 1 nighter before flying. Generally run down and tired. Carpet in room was frightful.

review.title: Noisy
review.reviewText: Noisy factory or something runs all night and can be heard over the noise of passing airplanes
review.negativeRemarks: Dirty, old, noisy
review.locationRemarks: Good location, close to airport and city

review.title: Three cheers for Citi Garden Hotel!
review.reviewText: We had a late night return flight, making it necessary to have our vehicle near the airport. We made the reservation, not really knowing what the hotel would be like. We were pleased with the room, and the service was outstanding. We will definitely use the hotel for future flights. We were surprised to discover that the rates were less expensive than taking the Airporter, and being near the airport allowed us to get an extra few hours of sleep before our outgoing flight.
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco, CA

review.title: met expectations
review.reviewText: It ws good value for the (low) price. It's not the Hyatt but fine for a good value sleep.

review.title: Good Deal
review.reviewText:
Beautiful classic hotel.. I really enjoyed my stay. My only 1 & 1/2 complaint is about the Chinese restaurant in the lobby area as there was an odor of tainted fish in the air and the display of the food at the buffet was unappealing, sparse and the host wasn't too warm in greeting us. There was one couple having dinner there and my wife and I asked them how the food was and they said the food is cold in temperature... We ate some crackers and milk that we brought from home and went to bed.

The continental breakfast was fine just as long as you're not allergic to gluten (Celiac disease). I'm on a restricted diet so luckily there's a IHOP down the street, about a block away.

I'm sure the hotel used to sell rooms for three times price it is now back in its day, but
It's a very nice hotel, you can't beat the price and I plan to stay there again in Late July. Enjoy!
review.negativeRemarks: Fishy smell in restaurant and no gluten-free products at the continental breakfast
review.locationRemarks: Very close to SFO/airport, close to the freeway, there's an IHOP about a block away and there is shuttle service to and from airport every 45 minutes

review.title: No words
review.reviewText:
I know the price was good, however, other details, as continental breakfast was awful.
They have only orange juice, no coffee only tea. Nothing else. The bed had a bad
or cheap mattress.
review.negativeRemarks: room and breakfast
review.locationRemarks: good

review.title: Great for early flight.
review.reviewText: Room was small but adequate, Shuttle to airport was great. Good value.
review.negativeRemarks: Room Size
review.locationRemarks: Near airport, great for catching early flight.

review.title: One night stay
review.reviewText: I needed a place to stay before an early morning flight and where I could leave my car for 8 days at a reasonable price. This hotel fit those requirements. I had read some of the other posts and I do agree that the room was cold. My biggest "complaint" would be no in-room coffeemaker. I would stay here again for this purpose.

review.title: good
review.reviewText: clean but ppl in next room made a lot of noise! not hotel's fault :)

review.title: Hotel next to airport
review.reviewText: If you are traveling in and out of SFO and need a place to stay - this is not a bad spot. The shuttle service is great and the drivers will take you to and from the airport. Hotel staff was very nice. If you need to get to and from the city using BART...you have to take the airport shuttle back to the airport as this is the only spot to catch it! Overall, not a bad place to stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Bed
review.locationRemarks: Location is close to airport.

review.title: unpleasant stay
review.reviewText: Difficulties of understanding and organization. Most unpleasant stay.
review.negativeRemarks:
poor breakfast
long wait for the shuttle

review.title: Uncomfortable and run-down
review.reviewText: Disappointing place, but not unexpected considering the package price, which unfortunately was the price range I required this time. I find it interesting that there are still hotels with pay per use Internet charges... Felt like it was 10 years ago. Also... Pillows were the most uncomfortable I've ever run across. Absolutely no give in them and woke up with a major neck pain. Next night I used the top blanket as a pillow.
review.negativeRemarks: Horribly uncomfortable beds, terrible breakfast selection, pay-per-use wireless Internet...

review.title: Old and dirty
review.reviewText: Stay away unless you can't find any better ones. Breakfast is awful. Wireless internet is additional charge and the signal is really bad.
review.negativeRemarks: Poorly maintained hotel. Rotten food spreading on the staires and drawing many flies and bugs, really disgusting!
review.locationRemarks: Very close to airport

review.title: Run, don't walk away from staying at this hotel.
review.reviewText:
The old adage "You get what you pay for" certainly rings true with this hotel. Our room was in the flight path of the airport so it was very loud. The room was very small, the bed was very hard, they skimped on towels, and the carpet was old and dingy. There was no microwave or small refrigerator and the television was small and old.

The Complimentary Breakfast was the epitome of cheap. Bread for toast, frozen waffles and pancakes, mini bagels, cold cereal, butter, jam/jelly, peanut butter, cream cheese, fruit cocktail in a bowl, coffee, watered down orange juice and some other fruit drink. The plates were the cheapest paper plates you can buy. I know this review makes me sound like a snob, I'm really not. But this place was just awful, spend the extra money and go up the road north less than a mile to the Comfort Inn off of East Grand. Their rooms are nicer, and the breakfast is a lot better. Plus you will not hear the airplanes there at all.
review.negativeRemarks: The planes going overhead until 1am in the morning.
review.locationRemarks: Convenient

review.title: not able to relax
review.reviewText: had a frog in my bed first night made stay uncomfortable could not relax

review.title: Get what you pay for
review.reviewText: Room itself was ok although had small older tv with rather uncomfortable bed. Disappointed when trying to do online check in for plane flight in the morning and discovered it was .39 cents a minute to use computer.

review.title: Will be back without a doubt!
review.reviewText: Great! Close to airport and a couple of great restaurants/ bars. Had an amazing time being in that area for the first time and room was definitely comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: Quietness and how close it was to the airport
review.locationRemarks: Away from loud city so I was able to sleep in comfort

review.title: This is a very old hotel ... dont expect much
review.reviewText:
The room that I was allotted did not have a bed in it !!!!
I had to walk all the way from back of hotel to the front desk, at 12 in the night after a tiring flight, to get the room changed. So, frustrating !!!
The breakfast was minimal (no fresh fruits, no fresh waffle, no eggs).
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast, condition and upkeep of hotel.

review.title: Suggestion
review.reviewText: Need a microwave and a small fridge in every room or at least a small fridge would be nice!

review.title: great hotel for everyone and an inexpensive price
review.reviewText:
my hotel stay was very pleasant. the place was clean and convinient. My room was very clean too. I only used this hotel to sleep at night and during the day went touring SF.

this could be a pro or con, depending on how you looked at it, while I was out the cleaning lady cleaned my hotel room. she fixed the bed, replaced the towels, and cleaned the bath/sink. No valuable was left in the hotel during that time, but at the same time nothing went missing. I thought that was nice of them to make my stay there more pleasant.

the noise of the airplanes were not too loud. the hotel was surrounded by other expensive luxury hotels, so i would assume they can all hear the noise too. My expectations was better than expected coming from a 2 star hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: very clean and lots of parking space
review.negativeRemarks: none, for this price i expected less but they provided more
review.locationRemarks: near the airport, located in a commercial area so you dont have to deal with the locals

review.title: I'd stay again.
review.reviewText:
Friendly staff, some nice upgrades to bathroom.
Near San Francisco Airport, but still quiet enough.
VERY convenient freeway access.
review.negativeRemarks: ONLY thing wrong was a small bit of dust in the bathroom fan.
review.locationRemarks: Between the harbor and freeway, just North of SFO

review.title: Super Satisfied
review.reviewText: Very close to S.F.O. and free shuttle. Restaurant at hotel was wonderful. Room was very clean and comfortable. Free breakfast was great. All in all....loved it and will stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: Cleanliness, the restaurant and the entry way to hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Didn't have one.
review.locationRemarks: Great location near airport

review.title: Good!
review.reviewText: For the rate you pay and with Continental Breakfast, you can't ask more than this.

review.title: Helpful staff, close to airport
review.reviewText: Very close to the airport. Staff was very helpful when we had a problem with our reservation. Bathroom was nice. Hotel is a bit older, but comfortable. Breakfast that was included was very basic. It was a bit noisy when airplanes when overhead, a room at the back might be better for sound. We kept the fan going all night to help mask the noise of traffic and planes.
review.negativeRemarks: the breakfast
review.locationRemarks: close to airport

review.title: free aids
review.reviewText: The hotel was very unclean and dreadful. Webasically found a quart of blood on the bottom of our mattress. Not recommended for anyone. I wouldnt be surprised if people in my group got a disease. Not worth it.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything
review.locationRemarks: Sketchy

review.title: A place to put your head
review.reviewText: Had a late flight. Needed to a place for my head to lay for 8 hours and then was out the door to San Francisco. Was fine for a cheap place to put your head. Had a free shuttle which was nice to have.

review.title: OK for a short stay.
review.reviewText:
The carpets looked old and the room smelled to cigarette smoke.
The bathroom was perfectly clean and looked brand new.
Conveniently located near the airport.
The shuttle service was good and the restaurant area was nice.
It works for a short stay.

review.title: nightmare in the garden
review.reviewText: This is not a hotel its an motel!!!!! Really said how they hide behind picture on the web taking ppl money.....I was ready to leave...

review.title: Exccelent to stay
review.reviewText: Great ! It is convenient since it is close to the airport and nice shuttle for free
review.negativeRemarks: yesterday
review.locationRemarks: close to SF Airport

review.title: A-ok
review.reviewText: Great for a quick stay. Did the job. Easily would stay again.

review.title: Convenient and clean with some challenges.
review.reviewText: First stay was on the second floor, and difficult to get my large suitcase to room without help up the outside stairs. Fairly new interirors were welcoming.Faucet dripped all night. Breakfast bar,,,don't bother. Eat elsewhere. Second stay was on the first floor. On site restaurant was terrible.AND over priced. Requested wake up call but it didn't happen, my back up personal alarm did. Close to airport. Since my destination was the city it was OK for the money as a good stop over hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Pleasent furnishings, manicured grounds, and very close to the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: No elevator to second floor for luggage. Exterior doors. Food sources were terrible. No hand soap second stay. No wake up call. Faucet drip.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the airport. Easy to get to. Central to all of the Bay area.

review.title: ok
review.reviewText: Well it seemed more like a motel than a hotel it was like a motel 6 upgraded..and the thing that makes it worst is that there are people partying there and its an outside hotel not inside but breakfast was ok and and service was ok..
review.negativeRemarks: party people there alot
review.locationRemarks: the location was not great right next to freeway but it was awesomely close to the airport

review.title: Great stay! Loved it
review.reviewText: This hotel was great! Me and my two friends really enjoyed our stay. Nice rooms and a grassy area to sit outside
review.positiveRemarks: The people staying at the hotel, The yard

review.title: pleasant surprise
review.reviewText: I was extremely worried reading some of the comments posted. I was very pleasantly relieved to find the accommodation very satisfactory for the rate I paid, there is a free shuttle service back and forth from airport and I could take the BART from airport into the town center to go the conference, did not have to pay extremely high prices to stay down town, travel took about 30 to 40 minutes to the convention center.
review.negativeRemarks: TV was still old style a flat screen would have been great
review.locationRemarks: accessible to airport within a few minutes

review.title: Bad night.
review.reviewText: The rooms heater was not working, it was a pretty cold night. The free continental breakfast was even worse. The pancakes were molded. Not a very pleasant stay.
review.negativeRemarks: service was terrible
review.locationRemarks: convenient location close to airport.

review.title: What you pay is what you get
review.reviewText: Its a budget hotel what you pay is what you get. Breakfast is free and it consists of cereal, toast and frozen pancakes and waffles. Room is cold even with heater on because it kept shutting off and on, on its own. You hear trailers outside through out the day and night. Buffet in hotel is HORRIBLE would not recommend anyone to eat there and expensive not worth the money we spent. Bed was hard as a rock and pillows completely flat I would recommend you bring your own. There's a small television with hardly any channels to watch and they charge for internet good thing I didn't use it. Overall, if your hardly in your room its worth the cost but don't expect to sleep much.

review.title: Hotel was O.K.
review.reviewText: Their continental breakfast left something to be desired. The most awful waffles to be toasted. I could chew but not swallow. Just plain toast and bagels was better.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast, lack of coffee in room
review.locationRemarks: Very near airport, with schuttle available

review.title: Need to replace the chairs.
review.reviewText: Arm chair in room has a hole in the seat fabric. The desk chair had a huge stain in the seat. Bed was firm but I sleep well everywhere.

review.title: Pleasing
review.reviewText: Everything was perfect including the bathroom and the view and especially the price of the hotel. The only bad thing was the bed was a little uncomfortable. I would have like a softer bed so I didnt toss and turn all night. Overall it was pleasent.

review.title: Need to Park and Fly?
review.reviewText: I have stayed at this hotel multiple times over the last few years. The one and only reason we stay at this hotel is because the Park and Fly can't be beat. For less then a hundred dollars you can leave your car at this hotel for 14 days. Having said that I was very disapointed in our stay this time. We requested double beds and ended up with a king. We had to call the front dest three times before anyone would bring us a roll away. The carpet was extremely dirty and worn but for the price we paid I can't complain to much. I would only recommend this hotel if you need a place to park your car while on vacation.
review.negativeRemarks: It could be alot cleaner
review.locationRemarks: Close to the airport

review.title: For only one day
review.reviewText: Staff could be more welcoming. Breakfast options were not as good as I have seen in other hotels. Overall it is good for a day or two stay. Walkways are right in front of the door and the guests were talking very loud at night time causing to wake up from sleep. Air plane noise is also causing issues if you don't sleep deeply. TV was breaking off and making strange noises.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast and air plane noise.

review.title: Great if your going to airport.
review.reviewText: Room was clean but needed updating bed was ok but could use a mattress pad. Please put new pillows, these pillows are flat as a pancake. Location to airport was great. Love the park and fly.
review.negativeRemarks: bed and pillows
review.locationRemarks: great for the airport

review.title: 49er Playoff Game
review.reviewText: Good location and easy to find. Easy freeway access and close to airport. Good value for the price.
review.negativeRemarks: No Free Wi-Fi. Rooms could use some updating
review.locationRemarks: Close to freeway, airport and Candlestick park.

review.title: better than expected
review.reviewText: The hotel was a great deal for the price. The only irritator was that we had requested late check-out because it was New Years Day. Yet the maid tried to come in and clean our room at both 9am and 10:45am, well before regular check out.

review.title: Not Amazing, but not terrible, I would return!
review.reviewText: The hotel was more of a "motel" atmosphere; however the room was clean and nice. There was no fridge, and the ice machine was out of order, but it was very enjoyable.

review.title: Nothing Special, Budget Friendly
review.reviewText:
If you're on a tight budget, this may be your best bet for the area, but remember you get what you pay for. Everything was clean, the hotel staff was friendly, and it was nice to be able to catch the shuttle to the airport.

We had a room with 1 queen bed for two of us, and the room was pretty small, but okay for just 1 night. The bed, however, was really hard and uncomfortable, thin blankets, and just one not-so-great pillow for each of us, so we didn't sleep well. Though there are pictures of a buffet on Expedia, the breakfast they served did not compare to these photos. They had some fruits and breads, as well as toaster waffles and toaster pancakes. There is an Ihop down the street, within walking distance, that would make for a better breakfast.

They do have an outdoor pool that might be nice in the summer, and their large courtyard looked well kept. If I had the option to go back, however, I'd probably spend a few extra bucks to go somewhere else.

review.title: Good value
review.reviewText: A real suprize

review.title: Great place before you fly
review.reviewText: I stayed at CitiGarden the night before I was to fly out of town. The room was nice, but dated. I was concerned when I could see light between my room's AC unit and the wall (potentially letting in bugs) and my white socks became dirty just walking around the room. Other than that I loved the hotel. The service was FANTASTIC, I loved the convenience of having a good restaurant on grounds (Chinese buffet), and I was allowed to leave my car parked for a cheaper fee than the long term parking at the airport. Overall, I would stay there again before flying out of town.

review.title: For the cost there are better alternatives available
review.reviewText: Great location if you're on a brief stay for an overnight international hotel, but the cost to benefit isn't too great.

review.title: Nothing great, Nothing horrible
review.reviewText: Nothin really that good but nothing too horrible to overlook for a cheap hotel. No bugs crawling around but door was drafty and you could see outside under the door the gap was so big. Don't try to go even 5 minutes early they are VERY strict about they're check in time. Frozen panckackes and waffles you can heat up for breakfeast.

review.title: Good bang for your buck
review.reviewText: We were cautious when arriving into the hotel due to the reviews. We thought the receptionist was great, the breakfast well stocked, and the rooms plenty clean. For what we paid, we got great service. For those of you going into the city on the cheap, there is a bus service that takes you a couple blocks from Union Square, very convenient/inexpensive compared to the BART

review.title: Pretty, close to the airport
review.reviewText: I was positively impressed with the hotel considering the low price. Close to the airport, with shuttle service, has a nice courtyard, and the area has several restaurants within walking distance. The room was big, bathroom clean and modern enough, they brought an iron and ironing board when I asked. Breakfast was included, but didn't get to have it because my plane was very early.

review.title: Only if your on a budget
review.reviewText: This room served it's purpose but the only really complaint I have is that the Bed was so uncomfortable... The mattresses need updating... We only stayed to sleep because we were out on the town all day...

review.title: Best $ bargin hotel around
review.reviewText: For the price you can't find a better one with a clean, quiet room and nice breakfast.

review.title: Useful airport stopover
review.reviewText:
Hotel was fine- but our room had icemachine outside- so noisy- despite temperatures dipping! Good for overnight airport stay- at the cost we were happy with the convenient location.
Hotel check in staff great and friendly. Breakfast absolutely adequate for our purposes- simple continental as stated. Chinese buffet next door was extremely good value- and lots of seafood, but service was offhand- perhaps we were too near closing time.
review.locationRemarks:
San francisco is a fabulous city- lots to see and do- cycling over golden gate Bridge with ferry back from Tiburon was a highlight, as was trip to Alcatraz.. took in a football game- 49ers v Cleveland- great day out.
City centre area, Fisherman's Wharf both have affordable and decent accomodation in our experience- but the many beggars in all areas was intimidating- no different from any big city.
Highly recommend

review.title: Quiet and Comfortable
review.reviewText: Very close to the airport with free shuttle service. Enjoyed the garden view, nice calm atmosphere.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: Very cheap, so-so sized room with free shuttle and breakfast, but the pancake that came out in the breakfast had a mold on it, and I found a mite on my bed ( squished it and blood came out so I supposed I was sucked). It is cheap with a reason so be aware.

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText:
Room was facing road, front door had a quarter inch gap around it therefore noise level high, when i pointed this out to reception was given another room without any fuss, unable to get a hot drink, and no facility to make a cuppa,
the pillow case has stained with mascara, luckily there were 3 others, biscuit paper by bed,When I awoke in the morning had bites along the right side of my body!!!!!!!!! I pointed this fact out to the receptionist, who said Oh I'll tell the
housekeeper!!!!! showed no concern at all

review.title: Awesome services
review.reviewText: Thank you to the staff that made our trip much better!

review.title: You get what you pay for
review.reviewText:
We were trying to save money by staying at a lower rated hotel. I don't mind paying a little extra to have the piece of mind knowing that the hotel is going to be clean inside and out. This place is nothing to brag about and the outside of the hotel reminds you that you are staying at a lower rated hotel for a reason. The stucco on the wall is falling off, ice machine is leaking water, breakfast sucks, walls are paper thin, the pillows sucked, the carpet in the rooms in dirty, the tv was old and small, etc. My wife tells me I am being too picky but I feel comfortable sleeping some where that is similar to our own living conditions at home.

On the positive side the front desk was very helpful, the lobby was nice, other people staying at hotel were normal and not ghetto people. The room and bathroom was big. Clean bathroom, good location and free parking.

It may work for most people and I am not a snob I just like staying some place that I feel comfortable at and that looks clean from the outside. Maybe I am being too picky but I wouldn't go back. Room rate was pretty in expensive and we were on a budget,

review.title: NICE AND CLOSE TO SAN FRANSISCO
review.reviewText: really nice simple, and affordable stay in in the month of october was nice weather and everything be stay here again.

review.title: Close to SFO
review.reviewText:
We stayed in SF only one night and needed somewhere close to the airport with free transportation. We did get that. However, the beds were not super comfy and the blankets did not really even fit the beds. The tvs are tiny and the reception continued to go in and out. Last and most important and the worst part was that there did not seem to be hot water for my shower in the morning.

The price was right and the location was good.

review.title: You Get What You Pay For
review.reviewText: Forced from the downtown area owing to convention overload, I chose this hotel. It was well belowminimum standards for hotel condition, in serious need of updating. I would look elsewhere long and hard before choosing this place.

review.title: the Ramada in Minneappolis is good
review.reviewText: comfortable room, clean and tide, you can print papers in the lobby, quite convenient, I had a wonderful night staying in the hotel

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: very old matteress

review.title: convenient for the airport but not so for downtown
review.reviewText:
The CitiGarden is a much re-named airport MOTEL, but with a Hotel-like front building. It is clean and tidy and the pleasant inner grassed areas are well maintained. The breakfast is good by usual US motel standards with a fair variety on offer. However it is only available until 09.30 every day and there is barely enough seats available even when overspilling into the TV lounge area.
We chose this hotel based on availability and price. We thought being out at the airport would be ok because there is a fairly frequent hotel shuttle to all airport terminals where you can interchange with the BART rapid transit system. however if planning to visit the city for a number of consecutive days, it costs $16.20 round-trip and there is no return discount or multi-ridership ticket available and furthermore it is not associated with the MUNI system in SF despite interchanging with it at a number of downtown locations. The MUNI multi-ridership tickets are available for 3/5/or 7 days and priced from $21 upwards

review.title: Not impressed; smelled like smoke
review.reviewText: Smelled like smoke. Had to get keys charged multiple times. Bed sank in the middle.

review.title: Convenient to SFO
review.reviewText: Slow service at front desk...often, a line had formed with only one receptionist during late afternoon check-in time. Breakfast OK. But, it was convenient, quiet, and comfortable!

review.title: Horrible service
review.reviewText: The hotel itself is not all that bad. What was horrible was their housekeeping service. For this trip I booked three rooms which were all found in different areas (different buildings) of the hotel. None of the three rooms were ever cleaned during our stay. When I told the front desk it did not seem to surprise them much or really have to care about what I had to say.

review.title: Not worth
review.reviewText: The only good thing about this hotel is its location. It's just 12-15miles drive from the downtown. Other than that, there is nothing great about this. It feels more like a motel. I was told that there would be some security deposit held and any phone calls made would be deducted from it. Ironically, there was no phone in our room! There is no free wi-fi available. Breakfast offered is just ordinary.

review.title: Not too impressed.
review.reviewText: Well, in total this is a really nice hotel. And it's clean and nice. But there's no dryer in the room and the internet is so expensive for really low speed. I can't even receive the internet signal in my room! That really pits me off.

review.title: "will never go back"
review.reviewText: Accommodation was not up to my standard.

review.title: Will never recommend this to anybody!!!
review.reviewText: Dirty carpets, run down blankets and pillows,smelly room, no security, most occupants are loud and rude...will never ever go back in this hotel.

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText: I was disappointed with the attitude of personnel at the hotel. I received a confirmation of reservation from Expedia including a king size bed. When I arrived, I did not get the king, but two twin beds. When I asked about it, I was told by hotel personnel that I should complain to Expedia. They told me that my reservation was relative to availability at the hotel. I was under the impression that I would receive what I obtained in my confirmation papers from Expedia. With such a negative attitude, I would find it difficult to recommend the establishment to others and it blemished my opinion of Expedia. I thought that any hotel that you recommended would be more interested in complying with the confirmed reservation made through your company. I was displeased with the treatment I received from hotel personnel and the fact that they were recommended by you.

review.title: Very good hotel for the money, perfect choice for students!
review.reviewText: Staff were extremely helpful and knowledgable about the city and tourist and transport locations. Service staff were friendly as well. Room could have been more comfortable but for the price, it was as expected.

review.title: Stay away from this hotel - They do not care!!!
review.reviewText: As a frequent traveler, I can honestly say this is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in! Within first 24 hours after I checked in, they assigned my room to two other travelers after I already occupied the room. The first incident happened on the midnight of the first day. I am a single woman. When I was sleeping, a guy used a key and entered my room. Needless to say, I was extremely terrified. Fortunately, he was a gentleman, he realized the room was already taken, so he turned around without coming in. I immediately got up and locked my room from inside. Next morning, I reported this incident to the hotel, but they assured me that would not be possible since a stranger can not have my room key. Only three hours later, a couple used another key to enter my room. The hotel assigned my room to them, again! When I was furious to confront the hotel vice manager (the manager was too busy on the phone), she explained to me that their system does not show that my room was taken. I insisted to change my room after that. The hotel never formally apologize to me and the manager never showed up. I think it is obviously that they do not care about customers. I was fortunate that the first guy was a gentleman. I can not imagine if otherwise! Do not use this hotel. They are just terrible!!!

review.title: Nice for the Price
review.reviewText: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights and it was just fine for the price we paid. We weren't in it very often just to sleep. The beds are hard, but most cheaper hotels have hard beds. It was clean enough for our needs

review.title: OK
review.reviewText: It was at a convenient location. Rooms were clean.

review.title: sharon
review.reviewText: this hotel is very close to SFO, with a Chinese buffet in the lobby

review.title: clean and quiet..
review.reviewText: Not very many stores near by but it was clean and quiet. my son went for a swim and forgot to bring extra clothes lucky for him the hotel had a dryer. The laundry room was tiny but when you need to wash or dry something who cares what it looks like. I would book another stay if I come back :)

review.title: it was ok
review.reviewText: i guess for the price it wasn't the worst. i felt like it was a glorified motel 6. i could hear people walking with their luggage, the busy road, people talking.....not the amazing. however, the staff was very nice. i guess if you want to go cheap, its not too bad. i would have paid the extra 30 dollars for something a little better. the pictures made it look more comfy than it was

review.title: This place is a dump!
review.reviewText: This place is a dump. Run down. The only thing that was nice was the lobby, but that is where it ended. It is noisy. The hotel is right by the airport and a busy road. OK, so you would think they would accomodate for that by having good sound insulation, NOT! There was a big gap at the bottom on the door and I heard everything! The bed was hard, the pillows were flat. This place would be decent for $40 per night, but not for what I paid per night! The breakfast was way below par. I know it says continential, but many other hotels are much better for about the same money. The best thing at the breakfast was peanut butter and jelly sandwiches. Go next door to the holiday inn or somewhere else!

review.title: Good choice for a casual visit
review.reviewText: Very well located, surprisingly quiet for an hotel located right at the airport this was a good choice and ended to be a fair price as well. The rental car return was 2 mnts from the hotel and SF downtown was a 20 mnts drive at most - we spend an evening in town, return the car and flew away ending a vacation trip without any troubles. The hotel Breakfast is not the best though (standard toast and industrial jam + coffee/tea or corn flakes) but this was the only small problem.

review.title: decent for price...
review.reviewText: If you need the luxurious amenities of a microwave or minifridge this is not the hotel for you. Also the wifi is 7 bucks a day and the TV is nothing short of miserable. If you just need a place to crash its OK. Its next to the airport and close enough to the city. Not recommended for extended stays though.

review.title: Reasonable for the price
review.reviewText: Good breakfast, furniture in room needs update, noise from landing airplanes, overall - good for the price.

review.title: Tired Hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel seems to be missing some services that are expected in modern hotels: Free Wi-fi, Tea/coffee machine, information notice/booklet. Staff also misinformed us about availability of Laundry detergent and change given on local bus service( $2 trip to CBD - no change given). Staff also seemed to have a 'don't care' attitude.

review.title: A good price for an OK hotel
review.reviewText: We started our vacation and finished our vacation at this hotel! Late check in was a plus with frequent airport shuttles that were available in the wee hours of the morning! There was a mix up on reservation that the hotel did not help correct telling us to deal with expedia, expedia was great and fixed it for us! Thanks expedia! Compared to our Rome Hotel, we paid less and got more at this hotel however, compared to other area hotels, this was just a cheap stop with no extras. We will pay a bit more and stay somewhere else our next stay near SFO. Note: Our first night didnot allow for much sleep as the other guest were quite loud with music etc and it went on for some time. The front desk must have have been really busy at the front dest since the problem with the noise was not corrected and exhausted on our part we fell asleep with earplugs in and only got 3 hours of sleep with an early flight. We left very tired then had to fly fifteen hours.... The sleep would have been nice

review.title: Good Value
review.reviewText: Good value for area around SFO

review.title: Eh. The price is right.
review.reviewText:
I guess with how much I paid for this hotel compared to the prices of the other hotels out there, it really was a good deal. It basically depends on what you're expecting. If your only concern is money, this place is fine. If you're looking for a really great place, go somewhere else.

First impressions on the hotel were that it looked a liiiitle bit not as nice as I had expected, not bad I guess, but somehow the CitiGarden logo looked cheap. The lobby however is pretty nice. When it comes to the room, overall it was pretty good. Don't even really know what to say, it looked like a normal hotel room. However, there were a couple of dissatisfying things about the room's cleanliness--in fact, now that I think about it, they were all in the bathroom. First of all, there was some kind of dirt on the inside of the door. Then, you could tell the maids clean the handle and faucet of the bathtub every time, because they were sparkling, but not the nozzle. Doesn't fall into one's line of sight as easily. Then--and this is total nitpicking--the soaps were tossed haphazardly onto their spot on top of the toilet tank. They were all either upside down or backwards. Not a big deal, but shows that the maids aren't really focused on attention to detail.

I suppose the biggest issue was the towel bar on the front of the sink outside the bathroom. When I pulled a towel off to dry my hands it crashed to the ground. I replaced it gingerly. Also, the TV was small and batty.

review.title: VERY close to the airport
review.reviewText:
This hotel was good for the one night, but I probably will not stay there again in the future. The bathroom was nice and the room was OK, but the noise factor was pretty high. I did choose it because it was close to the airport, but next time I think I make stay a bit further away because of the airplane noise.

Shuttle arrived on time and it was about what I was looking for, but next time I will like stay a few more miles away and forsake the time for a better night's sleep.

No iron or coffee in room either, so it they are important to you, look elsewhere.

review.title: I dont think i'll be back here again
review.reviewText:
A lady who was at the front desk was as rude as she can be... I just arrived at hotel after 6 hours of driving from LA and she does not even look at us while she asks "yes?". No hello, how are you, are you checking in, etc. just "yes?"

not only that, but when she asked us "yes?", she tells us that there was another person who is actually in front of us. the tone of her voice is as if we cut on the line or something... well, there was a person who was sitting on a sofa about 15 yards away. how am i supposed to know that that person was in front of me? she sounded angry and exrtremelyy rude, like she was having the worst day of her life.

she was a filipino lady, about 50-55 years old. She completely made me and my wife angry... we did not say anything but we will NEVER go there again. although it is not a five star hotel, must the employers be so low-classed? never will go there again.

review.title: Food very Expensive
review.reviewText: The room itself and the grounds are very nice and the shuttle to the airport was very reliable. But. One of the reasons I chose this hotel was because I knew I wouldn't have transportation to other restaurants and the ad gives several choices for food at the hotel. When I got there, there is only one place to eat, a Chinese buffet. The food was pretty good, but extremely expensive, and not very friendly. The continental breakfast wasn't very good either.

review.title: WOW !!
review.reviewText: Wife and I arrived late in SFO and needed a place to crash before heading into SF. We picked this hotel because of the shuttle and price. For once I actually felt like I under paid. The lobby has the feel of a much more expensive hotel and the fireplace was a nice touch. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The property was very clean, landscaped and groomed. The outside had the older motel look and feel but the rooms were recently upgraded giving a more modern touch, including a flat screen TV. Continental breakfast was limited but considering the price it was better then expected. Overall, this was a great experience and I almost threw up in my mouth in amazement.

review.title: pretty good for the money
review.reviewText: nice and clean, old tv needs to go otherwise is all good!

review.title: ok hotel
review.reviewText: Truthfully, we arrived into San Francisco late and immediately went to bed. Breakfast was good.

review.title: for the price good and breakfest
review.reviewText: me and my family will stay here again!

review.title: It's worth the price
review.reviewText: It took a good fifteen minutes to check in three people. I was third in line, and there were two clerks. One was "very tired" but didn't really seem to know what he was doing. Two lights stopped working during our stay: one in the main room, and the bathroom, so if we didn't want to shower in the dark, we had to open the door to let outside light in. Also, the room had a very funky smell that wasn't noticed until we had breathed fresh air. The room was very cheap, so every time something went wrong, my friends and I chimed "We got what we paid for." The pool was unheated, which was a cold surprise. But the room was very big and the beds were fine. It's about a three star type of thing, but as I said, it was really cheap. Also, the free breakfast is really nothing special.

review.title: Not impressed. Very racist workers These guys don't support vets or miltary personal
review.reviewText: it was raining and my room floor was all wet, when i request my refund they didn't grant it and put me in another room which also had wet floors. And the Manager needs to take a class on customer service i do not recommend to any Military Personal. These guys don't support military vets.

review.title: It was ok for one evening but not my top choice
review.reviewText: My husband and I needed a place to stay because he had an early flight the next morning, but it was outdated and felt like a cheap motel. The front door faced an outside street so you could hear traffic or people walking by. It wasn't what I expected but it was cheap so I can't really complain. I was thankful for the shuttle to the airport. The breakfast was not food that we eat. It was all packaged, processed foods.

review.title: Not impressed.
review.reviewText: Its definitely the kind of hotel that you stay at just to stay the night then move on. It was on the cheaper side of hotels in the bay area thats probably the only reason we stayed there.

review.title: "Citi, really"
review.reviewText: From the outside the facility looks bareable, however from the inside it is a whole other world. The rooms smell, the carpets are dirty, and the staff was not really that helpful. Please bring your own towels, the towels were absoultely disgusting.

review.title: Convienent to SFO, 15 Min from Downtown SF, perfect for a place to stay, nothing fancy.
review.reviewText: Besides a lousy check in, I was impressed with the room: nice and clean, remodeled bathroom, bed was comfortable, everything was great. They have a courtyard in the middle of the hotel to take a walk around or relax. Continental breakfast was subpar, juice, toast, coffee, thats it. It was a good price, and I recommend it to anyone who's looking for a place to stay by SFO. They also have a buffet.

review.title: It's a very cozy and quiet hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is very cozy and quiet, the staff is friendly, safe and with access to the airport and the city, I recommend it.

review.title: A little Scary
review.reviewText: My husband and I were looking for an inexpensive place to stay outside of San Fransico. I had read the reviews of others and thought we take a chance with a different location other than a chain that i was familiar with. I soon regretted my choice.When we arrived their were police cars at a room next to ours. I thought this was a hotel but it was not. I was a motel so we drove up to our room. It being on the first floor and seeing the cops just a few feet a way i was a little nervous. We entered the room which was smaller than expected, but clean. I quickly closed the drapes and looked for the second lock. I really didn't feel secure. The night went on and as we "slept" we continued to here cars and people enjoying themselves next door. All night long there were noises car slams and than more. I was pretty appalled by the whole thing. I definitely do not recommend this no matter how cheap it is!

review.title: Helpful
review.reviewText: Great location to SFO and good long term parking rates. Amazingly huge Chinese buffet next door.

review.title: Great to park and fly, Chinese Buffet adjoining
review.reviewText: I parked my car at the hotel for 2 weeks on the "park-and-fly" plan while I flew out of town. It was mega-convenient, and cheaper than airport parking. The airport shuttle runs from the hotel on the half hour. The breakfast is not worth eating but the staff who placed the breakfast out was friendly. The wi-fi is an additional fee, but the room is still a great value. Room was clean and comfy. There is a Chinese Buffet adjoining the hotel. I only wish the outdoor hottub had been open because I would have gone in no matter the time of year.

review.title: I will be back! here
review.reviewText: very convenient,basic, but clean and comfortable

review.title: Cheap motel, no shuttle, poor breakfast. Stay elsewhere.
review.reviewText: The airport shuttle van did not show up. This is a motel with doors facing the outside. "Breakfast" is literally a bag of white bread and a jar of peanut butter with a plastic knife sticking out of it.

review.title: ok for a cheap place to park and fly
review.reviewText:
This was a "park and fly" deal. I live an hour north of San Francisco and stayed in this hotel one night the Tuesday before Thanksgiving before flying out super early, and left my car parked at the hotel for six days.

This hotel was one of the cheapest, and so I had low expectations. And they were met. It's a one star. Staff was friendly enough. The room was not a place I'd want to spend any more time in other than to check in, sleep, get up, and check out. The sheets were very thin and there were stains on the carpet that I'm pretty sure were dried blood. I didn't need the earplugs I brought, but I did use my eyepatches because I'm pretty sensitive to light. I did not try the shower or TV.

Before booking this place, you should consider that the hotel shuttle runs about every hour. So like me, you could be waiting at the airport outside in the rain at night for close to an hour for your shuttle bus to arrive, while watching other, probably more expensive hotel shuttles go by several times (this hotel shares the shuttle with three other nearby hotels, too... can't remember which ones.) If this and a dingy room are ok with you, this hotel is a convenient way to park and fly. I would have paid almost the same amount to park my car at the airport as I paid for this hotel, and that's primarily why I stayed here. That and the 6am flight.

review.title: Clean. Updated bathroom was nicer than expected.
review.reviewText: All in all a good value. Would consider going back.

review.title: Enjoyed our stay. Would use again.
review.reviewText: Hotel provided a nice economical place to stay during our first visit to San Francisco. Close to airport (Regular Hotel Shuttle Provided) and Public Transport to the City and Mall (Bus & BART). Simple, Clean and relatively easy on the pocket. Basically Good. Thanks again.

review.title: Hotel is convenient but the rooms are old and need new beds. No elevator access.
review.reviewText: I would recommend the hotel for the convenience factor. The price was accurate for the type of room. The rooms need new beds/mattresses if they are all like the one that I had.

review.title: Unprofessional Customer Service
review.reviewText: I can not emphasize enough how ustomer service was extremely unprofessional!!!!!! From the moment I arrived to check-in to the moment I checked out. If I'd known the Hilton was right next to them, I would have just gone there!

review.title: Great value for the price
review.reviewText: The updates to the hotel rooms are very nice. The only problem we encountered in the room was the a/c-heating unit was leaking water onto the floor & soaked a piece of our luggage. The pillows were VERY thin, but the hotel provided additional pillows at our request. The brand new grout around the bathtub was already falling off, which brings up concerns of mold issues as well as construction quality. We reported both issues to the hotel management. The bed was of medium comfort, and could certainly be upgraded, but for the price we paid to stay at this hotel, the accomodations were very reasonable, relatively quiet, & comfortable. The chinese buffet attached to the hotel was also terrific.

review.title: Very noisy!!!
review.reviewText: There was a lot of noise from other guests walking by. Insulation between rooms is very poor! When the guests in the next room were using their shower/sink the noise was so loud I couldn't sleep. I stayed in many hotels, and this is one of the worst when it comes to noise.

review.title: Great Value! Convenient Location! Would go back in a heartbeat. Very friendly staff.
review.reviewText: Upon a late arrival to CitiGarden, we were pleasantly greeted by a very friendly and informative lady at the front desk. Our room was very clean and tidy and we slept very well. The free breakfast had a lot of selections and was good. The hotel is conveniently located near the airport with a free shuttle service. The hotel grounds are beautiful and well kept. I will stay here again. The value for your money is the best in South San Francisco.

review.title: Bad behavior of reciptionest
review.reviewText:
i stayed in San Diego and San francisco in many hotels like comfort inn, quality inn, and many more even hostel, but i did not find bad hotel such as Citi Garden, not because of low quailit services, i expect that because of low rate, but i did not expect non profissional people in the reciption who are dealing with gusts with this very bad manner

i called the hotel form the air port asking the when the sutel bus timing she replyed withing five minutes, but me and others wiat for 40 minutes waiting the shutle bus.

review.title: Getaway week
review.reviewText: This was just a get away trip. As my girlfriend and I had neither been to the bay area before, we wanted someplace that was close to the airport but still convenient to many of the places we wanted to go. After reviewing many hotels online we decided on the CitiGarden Inn. After our visit, I have to say that this place fit the bill perfectly. It was convenient to the freeways which made travel to wherever we were going easy. As for the hotel itself, we had no complaints, called for an iron and ironing board shortly after check in and both were brought to the room in short order. No complaints about hotel, check in and out were both quick and painless. Only issue was no free internet. Wifi was available but at what seemed to be a bit too high of a price. Other than that everything was as expected.

review.title: I wouldn't stay here if it was free
review.reviewText: Wow, don't stay here, what a dive. The carpets were matted down, the bed was worn out, the handel fell off the toilet. Poor service. By far, the worst hotel I've ever stayed in

review.title: Great experience
review.reviewText: Great hotel for the price! It was a perfect location and not too far from the city. Bathroom was very clean and parking was very convenient. They also have late check-out which is a plus!

review.title: DON'T BE FOOLED BY PHONY REVIEWS, NICE WEB SITE PHOTOS OR CHEAP HOTEL PACKAGE DEALS!
review.reviewText:
DON'T BE FOOLED BY PHONY REVIEWS, NICE WEB SITE PHOTOS OR CHEAP HOTEL PACKAGE DEALS!
I booked at the Citi Garden Hotel in San Francisco which should really change their name to the Crappy Garden Motel. The lobby turned out to be the most attractive part of the facility and the place that appeared most appealing in the web photos. This place was nothing more than a motel that received a paint job in the rooms. The rooms while somewhat clean were very out dated. Fixtures in the bathroom were broken. The bath fan sounded like it was ready to blow. The bed covers were very old and faded and the mattresses must have been the originals since the place opened up 30 or so years ago and were very uncomfortable. Carpet was old & stained. I'm usually not to picky if the place is clean and comfortable but THIS PLACE WAS AN ABSOLUTE DUMP. The air outside smelled of fried fish & foods from the Chinese buffet on site. (we didn't eat there) The service was terrible. I had called to the front desk to order an ironing board and was told one would be brought to the room. I called a couple more times and waited 2 hours before walking to the lobby only to find out there were no more. I had also ordered a roll-away for one of our rooms only to find, at 1:30 am when we returned from an event, that it too had not been delivered. As I said I am not usually to particular if the place is clean and convenient. This place however is only convenient. You get what you pay for.

review.title: Perfect for what we needed.
review.reviewText: Perfect location for my huband's weekend seminar next door. Nice rooms, lobby and friendly staff. Couldn't beat it for the price. The buffet restaurant in the hotel was really good. Breakfast left much to be desired with just toast, cold cereal and canned fruit. Nice tile and fixtures in the room's bathroom. Bed was comfortable, everything was clean. Ice and soda machine were out of order/sold out :(

review.title: convenient to the airport!
review.reviewText: Perfect honeymoon town.

review.title: Travelers beware!!!!!!!
review.reviewText: This was the crappiest hotel I have ever stayed at. The whole place reeked from the smell of the greasy looking oriental buffet abutting the lobby. The staff were jerks. The out-door pool was too cold to use. And I haven't even reached the room yet. The door nearly would not close and lock. The carpet was filthy and worn out. The beds and bedding looked like they had been there since 1943. The soap and shampoo were so small that I had to get two more of each to shower. This place should be put down like a rabid mangy mutt.

review.title: It was good for just changing hands
review.reviewText:
We arrived at 1p and couldn't check in until 3p we could lock our things in the lobby closet but it was very odd. The bathroom needed some serious updating. No vanity at all to put your belongings. The bathroom had no storage or drawers to put anything just a floating sink.

Pillows were like a sheet of paper I had to ask for 2 additional ones, because there was nothing to them.

Overall I'd say it was a place to lay down and sleep. I wouldn't have wanted to spend much time in the room other than for that. 2 maybe 3 stars at best.

All of the employees were very courteous, but they had to be to make up for the rooms. I can tell it's under new ownership and they have a long ways to go.

review.title: You get what you pay for
very good value with convenient location
review.reviewText:
The location was great with free shuttle service to and from the airport. I didn't have a car but with a huge parking lot I can see great value in using it as a park and fly hotel. The room was clean and comfortable. I was there to see San Francisco, not the hotel, so all I needed was a place to sleep with easy access to get into the city. With Caltrain a 10 minute walk away from the hotel it was very easy and inexpensive ($2.50 each way) to take the train right to downtown San Francisco.

Pros: location, clean, price, free airport shuttle, access to transit and highways
Cons: bed was average at best and pillows were small, area lacks amenities

Overall, I would stay there again.

review.title: airport stay
review.reviewText: this was a very good reasonably priced airport hotel with the bonus of a regular airport shuttle bus

review.title: Citi garden
review.reviewText: Hotel is being renovated - our bathroom was not complete- no vanity or surface to hold items; toilet ran/leaked all night/ very noisy between rooms, bathroom fan sounded like a jet plan tgaking off; front desk clerk at check in and check out not helpful- curt and rude.

review.title: Decent hotel, Older room
review.reviewText: The beds were comfortable and everything was clean, but the room had older decor. Lobby is super nice so we expected a posh room too, but were highly disappointed. Overall it was comfortable though.

review.title: You get what you pay for: -Value-
review.reviewText: You get what you pay for. In this sense you get value and with that a peg lower in quality. I have no complaints and would stay again. I would go to a nicer place though, financially permitting. . .

review.title: Dirty Sheets
review.reviewText:
But the main complaint about this hotel is the dirty un washed sheets she had a room with 2 dbl beds both were dirty,
When she asked the front desk for clean ones they gave her sheets unwashed wrinkled ... I didnt notice until i was reading feedback from others who stayed there they had the same issues.....
Just plain nasty....

review.title: Decent
review.reviewText: The hotel was very decent for what we paid. There are loca buses that drop off in front of the hotel for $2 but take 30 minutes to get from Union Sq. and back. Not bad if you are on a budget which we were.

review.title: You get what you pay for!
review.reviewText:
Everything here is substandard but what else would you expect for this price in San Francisco. It's an ok place if you have a car and only need a place to sleep.
At check-in everything went smoothly. However, right of way I noticed that the people who work here are very sloppy (what you would expect when you go to a motel) but it didn't bother me too much. The lobby itself is probably the nicest part of the hotel.
The room itself is again, very basic. The bed is very old and the pillow is as flat as it can be (I suggest bringing your own pillow). It has a small tube TV, which my husband hates. The bathroom is updated with new granite vanity and the shower is clean. I thought for the price it was a very nice bathroom.
As for the continental breakfast, I just want to give you a fair warning. It consist of bread (which you can toast up), mini bagels, cereal, milk, organge juice and coffee. Most people walk into the room in shock. So be prepare or go have breakfast at IHOP.

review.title: Great place for a hotel party!
review.reviewText: Scary! Dirty linens. Stinky room. Big bass party music till 4 am. Enjoy!

review.title: Best place to relax after a 49 mile drive
review.reviewText: Hotel was really close and easy to get from the airport. About 10mins from Down town SF but that's if you drive fast like me. The room was more than I expected. It wasclean look like recently remodel. Free breakfast was ok, regular continental breakfast.never got to go in the pool because it was really cold, but pool look pretty clean. Definetely a good hotel.

review.title: "hotel and a chinese buffet together as one?...count me in!"
review.reviewText: Overall, this hotel is a perfect example of what "comfort and welcomed" is all about. Because of its excellent service...I'm coming back to this hotel again next year! Hey how about a free night???
review.userLocation: Bakersfield, Calif...About 30 mins. away from hell

review.title: Citi Garden Hotel is excellent value and so convenient
review.reviewText: As above

review.title: great room, not good for early flights
review.reviewText:
The room was nice, large, and great value.
As an airport hotel I felt that the services could be improved for the early flights.
-The airport shuttle went to more than one hotel and ran on a half-hourly schedule so extra time needs to be alloted to get to the airport
- The breakfast was not available before 6:30
-The WI-FI was $6.99 and no business center for on-line check-in

review.title: Make sure you leave plenty of time for check out!
review.reviewText: Check in was a breeze and the person behind the front desk was very pleaseantand helpful. The room was quitenice and seemed to have been remodled recently. Everything was very clean too! I also didn't hear much airport noise which was nice considering how close it was. At checkout I wasn't so lucky. 5am and there was no clerk behind the desk. I had to wait 20 minutes (literally) for someone to finally come and help me. I almost missed my flight.

review.title: Plan to visit again with my wife.
review.reviewText: Good value for the money.

review.title: Basic conveniences at a good price
review.reviewText: I was traveling on a very tight budget, so I appreciated the affordable room rate. The laundry room was flooded one night and the equipment in the exercise room was broken and run down. I alerted staff and they seemed to be responsive. The continental breakfast was a bit of a disappointment ... cold cereal, toast and bagels, and giant jars of peanut butter! However, I did appreciate hot coffee in the morning! Great shuttle service to the airport and BART. I would go again, but don't expect too much.

review.title: Will return again
review.reviewText: Hotel is clean and breakfast is good which consist of cereal, peanut butter sandwich, juice, coffee, tea etc.. No coffee maker in room. Wi-fi is not free. Transportation is very convenient to airport and downtown.

review.title: great deal
review.reviewText: This was a great deal. The staff was courteous and helpful. Breakfast was lean, but there was no additional charge, unlike many 4 star hotels! It's also conveniently located near the train and the airport.

review.title: going to go back when i go up to berkeley
review.reviewText: great hotel. it isn't really a hotel, it's like an outdoor motel kind of setting which surprised me at first. however, parking is easy and great, and the hotel room was very big and extremely clean. the room was high quality! i would recommend it to travelers. the location was weird just because it's like right next to a holiday inn and it was hard to spot at first... there's a swimming pool, but didn't have time to check it out plus it was too cold to be swimming anyways. complimentary breakfast only included milk and cereal and some toast with jam... front desk is very friendly... i would come back, it's a great price. definitely worth it!

review.title: Terrible experience
review.reviewText: When we got to our room, it smelled bad--like urine. We had gotten in late from the airport, and were so tired we didn't want to deal with changing rooms. When we got in bed, the smell was even worse. We told the front desk the next morning and they didn't do anything like give a discount or apologize. It was a terrible experience.

review.title: Good for sleeping only
review.reviewText: The room is perfect but there is no microwave and even small fridge. Not good with the small children. But is perfect for just sleeping only. Internet is not FREE

review.title: Perfect for what I needed - the Stay, Park and Fly
review.reviewText: Easy check-in, nice enough room, convenient to SFO.

review.title: Never Again
review.reviewText: My stay at the hotel was horrible, but it was my vacation to San Francisco. Therefore once I left the premises I felt better. The toliet was broken and we had to deal with it after hours. Maintenance fail to fix it properly. I called the Hotel Manager due to a charge on my account that I was not told that it would be card, he had a very nasty attitude. He responed to me "what you expect...you are staying at a 2 Star Hotel". Just because the rooms are cheap...don't treat your customer cheap...also, the Ice Machines in our area of the hotel were broken and we had to walk in the cold dark night to find one that was working...Room Service never pick up their ring phone. THIS Hotel is a "Pure Joke". next time I will stay at a ____ 6 or 8. At least you get what they are offering....

review.title: clean and comfortable/convenient location
review.reviewText: The hotel room was clean and comfortable. Very convenient location. close to freeway and restaurants. important word here is clean. Continental breakfast was not at all good - very cheap.

review.title: Adequate Hotel
review.reviewText: Citi Garden is in the process of remodeling and if you get a redone room, it really isn't too bad. I stayed there before it had undergone remodeling and some of the rooms were in pretty bad shape. I was surprised how much it had improved. There is nothing special about this hotel. It is adquate for basic needs. I reserved a parking package so I was only there one night. No major complaints.

review.title: Run down hotel..... dirty.... pool broken.
review.reviewText: Run down hotel..... dirty.... pool broken.

review.title: Would not recommend this hotel to anyone.
review.reviewText:
The only way to flush the toilet in the room was to take off the lid of the tank and lift a lever inside the tank. Yuk.
The breakfast was bad; out of everything except cereal and white bread. Coffee, milk, cream cheese, butter, peanut butter all empty. This was Saturday AM.
When walking barefoot in the room, our feet got dirtier.
I had to walk around trying to get ice from 3 different ice machines before I found one that actually worked.
I definately would not stay again.

review.title: I'd definitely go back.
review.reviewText: Overall, I'd go back, if I go back to San Francisco in a hurry. The hotel was not at all what I had expected, and that is a good thing. It was a pretty as the pictures, and I wish I had taken photos of the room. The real 'problem' I had whilst there was the beds. But, when you've walked almost all of San Fran and come back, it doesn't matter you're just that tired. All in all. It was a very nice hotel and if I had no other option due to budget, etc. I'd reserve here.

review.title: clean, comfortable, and provides quiet respite. Will go back there and recommend to others.
review.reviewText: very friendly staff, clean hotel, quiet and nice neighborhhod

review.title: An average hotel for an average price
review.reviewText: You definitely get what you pay for. If you plan on spending the bulk of your time in San Francisco proper, then this hotel is good for "a place to sleep". Be aware that a drive to San Francisco is about 10-15 minutes, so you will have to spend some time on the somewhat confusing 101 highway to get anywhere tourist-y.

review.title: Good if you are waiting to fly out.
review.reviewText: Easy access to the airport. Catching the bus into the city was easy too if you have time to spare.

review.title: Good relation between pric and quality/location.
review.reviewText:
The reservation was OK. The hotel was nice, clean bedroom, clean bathroom and location near enough from SF (if you rent a car). I recommend this hotel.
Good relation between price and quality/location.

review.title: Cheap and clean SFairport hotel
review.reviewText: Having airport that close is the ony downside of this hotel.

review.title: Next to SFO
review.reviewText: A very convenient and cheap, comfortable hotel for an overnight stay next to SFO.

review.title: Keith Myers
review.reviewText: Ok for an overnight. Basic hotel but clean and quite. Breakfast is simple and not many seats.

review.title: Great stay near SFO
review.reviewText: This is the second time we stayed at the Citigarden and once again everything went well. As someone mentioned earlier, "for less than you would pay at long term parking" we enjoyed good service, the shuttle to the airport, a nicely decorated comfortable room with a nice light breakfast. It is not a flashy neighborhood but for an overnight before or after a flight-where you can leave your car, it is the ideal place.

review.title: priced right and would book again
review.reviewText: For the price the hotel was clean and the vanity and bathroom areas were new and clean. I would reccomend a second floor room to eliminate noise. We did not eat at the hotel's restaraunt but a nearby Denny's suited our budget well. The location was very convienant, freeway onramp was very close. If someone is on a budget this hotel is a good choice. The inside of the hotel was in good condition, new paint, bathroom areas etc. The outside areas were not the best it is a commercial area with a ugly canal next to the hotel, but we did not pick the hotel for it's immediate surrondings. We stayed 2 nights and would stay again.

review.title: happy
review.reviewText: The staff was great

review.title: Citi garden
review.reviewText: Clean, Quiet, and parking package was a great deal. I would stay here again.

review.title: Noisy and uncomfortable
review.reviewText: The walls are VERY thin...I turned on the bathroom fan to sleep. Only 2 flat pillows and the bed was hard. Needless to say I didn't get much sleep. I got what I paid for compared to the prices of the surrounding hotels I guess.

review.title: worth the money
review.reviewText: This motel like hotel is cheap but overall cleanliess and comfort of the room were not bad. Breakfast was simple and service was as expected. Not to expect too much per what you pay for. One drawback the wall cannot shield the noise much, you could easily hear the walking step and voice from outside of the room.

review.title: Not impressed!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
review.reviewText: Management show lack of professionalism when I registered a number of complaints. We encountered numerous problems with our room and no one was able to fix them. I was told that maintenance department was not on premise therefore the problems were not their concern but with the contractor. I found this totally unacceptable. I had asked for another room on the first floor beacause I wear legs braces on both legs and my travel partner has physical handicaps that make it difficult to manuver stairs. I was told there was no other first floor rooms available which I know for a fact the hotel was not nearly full at the time. I asked for a refund of 2 days and was told I was given the opportunity to move and I refused to go to the second floor therefore I was not intitled to any sort of refund!!!!!! I would tell anyone to STAY AWAY from this establishment and I would NEVER return under any circumstances. I would pitch a tent before going to this motel!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

review.title: "Will stay there again"
review.reviewText: This was my second stay at this hotel, and I find that is very clean and quite. It is close to all sorts of entertainment, San Francisco is only a short drive north (12 miles).

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: the hotel was clean, reasonably priced and accessible from the freeway. However, the pictures on the web are very misleading. The room only had two pillows, which were flat as a pancake. The garden area and the hotel need a lot of TLC (David Bromsted, where are you?). the furniture in the room and in the lobby show all the years of wear and tear. The continental breakfast was descent. If you are traveling on a budget and want a clean hotel, this place is perfect. Do not expect any luxury.

review.title: Very Impressed
review.reviewText: I was very impressed with Citigarden Hotel in SF. The room was very clean and updated. It was much better than what I expected and paid. I would definately stay again if I go to SF again.

review.title: Close to airport, BART, shopping, food, fun.
review.reviewText: LOVE MY ENTIRE EXPERIENCE WITH EXPEDIA, JET BLUE AIRWAYS, CITIGARDEN HOTEL.

review.title: Nice place at a great price.
review.reviewText: I have stayed at the CitiGarden through 2 name changes and ownership changes. It continues to be a nice place to stay with friendly personnel and nice rooms.

review.title: a nice airport hotel
review.reviewText: See above

review.title: Low cost hotel, but you get what you pay far.
review.reviewText:
Pros:
The location is pretty good, right off of the freeway.
The price is right.
The bathrooms are really nice.

Cons:
The adjacent "Chinese" restaurant made me sick to my stomach.
Although the hotel has free parking, virtually every place nearby has (expensive) paid parking.
The neighboring warehouse starts operating around 5:00am, and creates a LOT of noise.
The CH UP button on the remote was broken, and the CH DOWN button on the TV was also broken.
The walls are paper thin.

If you can deal with this hotel's downsides, it is a bargain for the bay area.

review.title: Excellent service and cost with no frills.
review.reviewText: The hotel was what we needed. Just a place to stay for one night. No additional frills. Clean and orderly. The attached seafood buffet restaurant is very good. It's a quite a distance from downtown San Francisco. A town car/cab one way is 50.00. When we fly out of San Francisco we plan to use stay and park feature.

review.title: Great place to stay will go back
review.reviewText: It was a quick, simple, and clean place to stay. I have stayed there a couple times and would continue to the next time I plan on visiting the city or going to a game.

review.title: Sleepless Night
