review.reviewText: This hotel was clean enough and convenient enough for the cheap rate I got, but it was extremely noisy in the evening and into the night until early morning hours. I could hear entire conversations through the walls and there seemed to be several parties going on in my hall.

review.title: Great Hotel for the price.
review.reviewText: Above

review.title: Citi Garden
review.reviewText: Rude front desk clerk (female)

review.title: Great value
review.reviewText: Hotel was an excellent value and personnel were friendly and helpful. Room was comfortable and clean and reasonably quiet. Transportation to the airport was reliable, but pick-up at the airport was very erratic.

review.title: Good value near SFO
review.reviewText:
Upon arrival, the exterior of the motel gave me the impression I was at a bargain basement place. However, once I stepped into the lobby, I was relieved as it was quite nice. The same could be said about my room. The exterior of the building I was staying was unremarkable, and honestly looked a little worn. Once again, what's inside is what counts, the room was well furnished, and looked practically new. Everything looked clean, and most importantly the bed was comfy. The only minor snag is that they are a bit stingy with their towels. I'm glad my girlfriend checked first before we hopped in the shower as there was only one large one and two small ones (a little larger than hand towels). It was a little hassle to go the lobby to pick up more. Overall, a pleasant stay.

Also, korean ramen noodles as part of the continental breakfast was kinda neat.

review.title: Good Location for Park n Fly to SFO
review.reviewText: I was searching for a Park n Fly package and found the Citi Garden Hotel on Expedia. Had trouble finding reviews due to the spelling of Citi. The motel is being remodeled and. our room was clean and comfortable. It did not have a refrigerator or microwave. Our flight was cancelled, and they were good about letting us check back in for an extra night at the same rate. The hotel offers a free breakfast, but we needed to leave for the airport before it was served. There is a Chinese Buffet restaurant attached, but we didn't eat there. You can find several restaurants nearby if you have a car.

review.title: Just what we needed
review.reviewText: Very close to the airport, nice stay at reasonable price

review.title: will stay there again when we go to the San Francisco.
review.reviewText: very nice place and nice and helpful staff.

review.title: ITS A MOTEL NOT HOTELwhat you pay is what you get!!!!!!!!!!!
review.reviewText: non smoking room smelled like nicotine. matresses on both beds were old and tearing from the bottom. the hair dryer had hairs on it. i didnt feel safe in this MOTEL. The only decent part of the room was the new bathroom. i do not recommend this motel especially to women. there is a dark hall way that you have to walk through. internet is not free in your room or anywhere on the property. free breakfast is only coffee and toast, and cold cereal.

review.title: Great price but very thin walls
review.reviewText: It was nice and close to the San Francisco airport in a decent area. The breakfast was good. There were laundry facilities available. There was a nice pool area ( with a hot tub) in the inner court. They had a very busy crew that kept things clean and nice. The only problem we had is that the walls were very thin and we were awakened several nights from noise in the next room. I called the front desk and they said they would call the other room. After I made 2 calls the problem was finally corrected.

review.title: For the Value I would recomment this Motel
review.reviewText: The CitiGarden was a great value, close to the airport and clean. The free parking is a huge savings when traveling. Beds were a little soft, rooms were recently painted and have updated fixtures in the bathrooms. It also was fairly quiet. For the value I would recommend this Motel.

review.title: Dreary, but close to airport
review.reviewText:
Close to airport. Decent room, especially for the price.
But the least attractive continental breakfast I can remember

review.title: Little motel close to airport
review.reviewText: My boyfriend and I were stuck in transit at the San Fran airport with no where to stay and an early flight the next morning. We decided to stay here based on the cheap rate, free shuttle and continental breakfast. Overall it was what we expected considering we just needed a place to sleep.

review.title: Caution - Don't Be Duped Like Me
review.reviewText: Don't let the name or the pictures fool you, this is a motel! It was a big disappointment. The room was not good, it was noisy. Unless you are looking to the "no-tell motel" stay away.

review.title: Decent and reasonable
review.reviewText: The Citi Garden is right off the freeway with plenty of parking. The room was a standard Motel 6 type room but I did not care because it was just for the convenience of not having to travel early in the morning to the airport. The continental breakfast was below par. The shuttle was a little late in the morning but coming back it was right there as soon I got to the shuttle stop and brought my back to my vehicle asap. Because I just needed a decent room and a place to park my vehicle at a reasonable I am happy with my choice.

review.title: Very impressed!
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice, staff courteous and helpful. I will most definitely stay at CitiGarden when in San Francisco again!

review.title: Very satisfied.
review.reviewText: My travel was fine as far as accomidations, flight, and car. Hotel brought us anextra blanket upon simply asking iftheyhad one. I very much appreciated that. I'm givng the Motel mostly 5's, not because it's 5 star or anything, but because smply for considering it for what it i, it was very nice.

review.title: No way
review.reviewText: no way would i stay there agien

review.title: clean, comfortable,& quiet economy motel
review.reviewText: This was about the 5th time I have enjoyed their hospitality in as many years. I have found it clean, quiet, comfortable and very convienent to SFO. Brekfast & the free airport shuttle are pluses. I am a satisfied customer.

review.title: Typical San Francisco airport budget hotel.
review.reviewText: Typical no frills San Francisco airport budget hotel. Good for in/out business travel. As close to the airport as you can get with a free shuttle. The grounds seem to be safe and secure.

review.title: Get what you pay for! good enough for sleeping and taking a bath!
review.reviewText: We rent a car in SFO airport , so we wasnt in the hotel all day long, so the room was good enough for sleeping and taking a bath, it was clean and the price matches the room we got!

review.title: Will definitely go back
review.reviewText: Very happy about everything. Clean rooms, very nice environment, helpful people.

review.title: A place to stay
review.reviewText: Not a bad palce...I've been to worse. I'd stay again!

review.title: A long wait for a poor room
review.reviewText: I made the reservation because my flight was delayed and I had turned in my rental car- the site said that they had an airport bus. But I waited for over an hour before the bus arrived, not getting to the hotel until just before midnight. I was awakened in the early morning by sounds of construction. To my horror, someone was repairing something in the adjacent bathroom and there was a 6" x 8" hole leading into my bathroom, so I did not feel comfortable using it. It went on for hours, with banging and talking and they finally sealed the ventilation hole.. The continental breakfast was gone by the time I could shower. Couldn't avail myself of the pool because it was out of doors. I won't be back.

review.title: I WAS VERY, IMPRESSED,Can't wait to go back.
review.reviewText: WE had a wonderful time,we're coming back.

review.title: convenient for a SF visit and relatively cheap
review.reviewText: the hotel undergoes a remodeling at the moment, breakfast is not too bad, close to Tanferon shopping center, San Francisco can easily be reached within 15 minutes by car

review.title: Dont Expect Too Much
review.reviewText:
The hotel looks good, the lobby is grand. Most if not all the rooms are located at the back of the hotel in a 2-storey type structure. if you have alot of luggages to bring, you have to bring them up to your room using the stair (yes, no elevators for a 2-storey building)
The room itself is cozy, the front is all glass with drapes, so you need to make sure that they are always pulled together. There is no water to drink unlike the other hotels where they have a fridge with complimentary water and/or coffee. just cups and a heater. No complimentary tootbrush and wifi connection (youll pay for this). Complimentary breakfast is at 6:30am, so if you're going to be out before 6:30am, i dont think you can even ask for coffee. Other hotels have like doggy bags for those guests who are going to be out before the breakfast buffet. If you're on a budget and just wants to have a place to sleep (you'll sleep soundly that is guaranteed) then his is the place for you. Otherwise, try to scout around for options

review.title: We preferred this hotel to others nearby we have used and will use it in future
review.reviewText:
Our recent stay at this hotel was our second; it has recently changed its name to City Garden Hotel and there has been refurbishing particularly in the bathroom area. The hotel is extremely quiet despite its closeness to the air port and a busy road.
The included continental breakfast is more than addiquate and the coffee is good.
We found their parking policy very useful for stays abroad for up to four weeks.

review.title: very basic hotel but cheap
review.reviewText: The room was very basic the carpet had mysterious red stains!! The complimentary breakfast was also very very basic but you get what you pay for and it was pretty cheap.

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: matress and box spring were filthy!

review.title: Get What You Pay For
review.reviewText:
Hotel was nice, but the neighbors are terrible. Very noisey hotel. Garbage pickup was between 2 and 3 a.m. every morning. There is a manufacturer that works 24 hours next door. I didn't have one good nights sleep the entire week I stayed here.

Overall the hotel is nice, but shower water was hot and cold. The breakfest buffet is skippy. Not much of a choice. Coffee tasted good though.

Overall, I would go out of my way to stay at another hotel.

Sorry.

review.title: flair on the outside with no maintenance
review.reviewText: The hotel has stuff that it can use to make it work but that is all. the receptionist was friendly and there was decent free airport shuttle that could be used however that is it. the room's carpeting was wet throughout the room as if someone had thrown water on it. The breakfast was awful. The non smoking room smelt like someone has just smoked in it. I will not recommend this place to anyone, except if they really want to save money or are just going to crash in for the night.

review.title: Will fit a busy traveler's needs.
review.reviewText: Roomy, comfortable, had washer and dryer facilities. Close to airport and highway. 5 mins from Rental Car drop off. Not fancy - not expensive.

review.title: Noisy but cheap
review.reviewText: The room where we were assigned was literally next to the highway and you hear people passing by and talking loud at night time. But price was pretty cheap! Settings were more like an "Inn".

review.title: Very disappointing hotel
review.reviewText: Our stay was very unsatisfactory. Our keys had to be reprogrammed several times. A maintenance man barged into our room to check the phone. He had no ID and no uniform. He was irritated that I asked for ID. My husband and I left the door open during his visit. Continental breakfast was disappointing with few selections and food that ran out and was not replaced. Dirty room; uncomfortable and lumpy bed; broken tub faucet; dim lighting in the bathroom; squeaky toilet lid; two flat pillows; hotel staff was not rude, but not friendly or helpful either. Would definitely not stay here again.

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: passing

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText: I paid for a 2-bed room because I was visiting San Francisco with a friend but when I checked in they gave me a room with one king bed instead and said they had a double bed room available for only the second night of my stay so rather than change rooms 3 times, I agreed to stay in the single room and needless to say, had three very awkward nights with my friend and I sleeping in the same bed. I was very disappointed. It's a good thing all the activities we did during the day in San Francisco were fun, or the hotel run-around may have ruined my whole getaway.

review.title: Warning: very low budget
review.reviewText: We decided to go with CitiGarden because the description stated that it was newly renovated and the pictures looked decent. We were on a business trip so we had to keep expenses down. I must say that I was very disappointed because the door key we were given didn't work. Every time we left our room and came back we needed to wait for the maintenance man to come open our door because they told us the key system is very old. The beds were very uncomfortable. Expect for the hot water to go on and off during your showers. I would not stay here again unless I was broke and had no where else to stay.

review.title: nice, clean and affordable
review.reviewText: I would stay in this hotel again

review.title: Not bad for the price
review.reviewText: I stayed at this hotel with my g/f to be near the 49er game the following day and for the price, it wasn't bad. True you hear the planes and freeway, but what do you expect when you want to stay near the airport. A lot of people commented on the noise and cleanliness, but for the price, it was okay. Not the best and certainly not the worst.

review.title: good deal,close to every thing-freeway&public transportation
review.reviewText: spotless room,very nice staff.enjoyed free breakfast spread. I will stay there again

review.title: Good place to stay.
review.reviewText: We were very happy with the hotel. The staff was extremely helpful. It had the shuttle to the airport which was a necessity for us. And the coffee was on at 4:00 AM.

review.title: Very Inexpensive a Plus, Horrible Service a Minus
review.reviewText: The CitiGardens was very economical choice for my partner and I. We are poor college students visiting South San Francisco for our good friends wedding. We checked in on a Friday afternoon and noticed some construction going on, on the floor above us. Since it was around 3pm we didnt mind. Around 5:30pm I called down to the desk asking when construction would be finished, I was told 5pm, when I said but its 5:30, the desk said it would be over soon. There was hammering and machine noise until we left for dinner around 7:30pm. We repeatedly called the front desk, who did little more than placate us, Ill check on that and it will be over soon were popular. We had a similar experience next day when my partner called down for an iron. He called about a few time and was every time told it was on the way. He went down to the front desk and they didnt have any behind the desk but they were going to send one right over. He finally saw another guest with an iron and got it from them. Overall the CitiGarden has recently been remolded but very poorly. We had a chair that was so badly stained that no one felt comfortable sitting on it without a towel to covering the stain! Our bed was Queen size but looked more like a Full. The wedding was a blast but no thanks to our accommodations at this place.

review.title: Reasonably Priced Airport Hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel lobby and main building have been recently renovated. Rooms were clean and nice size. Extra Folding Cot was really more like a double bed - but we were able to make it fit in the room. Pool area was nice, but the cooler weather and the fact that it is not heated made swimming not a option - unless you are a polar bear.

review.title: Dissapointed
review.reviewText: This hotel is nothing as it look on the pictures they show on the web, the carpet was dirty, the toilet was clogged, the beds were very unconfortable...Next time, I'm not staying there.

review.title: Good for Park N Fly
review.reviewText: We used this hotel for Park N Fly for long trips. It is convenient and it is reasonably priced. Seems like it is in the middle of rooms renovation. Hopefully, in the future, it can be a hotel which we can use for more than just Park N Fly.
review.userLocation: North Bay Across Golden Gate Bridge.

review.title: Would definitely stay there again
review.reviewText: The Hotel has a beautiful reception area which looks more like 4 stars than 2 stars. The garden looks nice too and is well maintained. The fact that the hotel does not sit right next to the freeway is a big plus. Most airport hotels are right next to the HWY. The restaurant offers a great buffet with a huge selection of seafood items. The airport shuttle is a great bonus.

review.title: Very dissapointed
review.reviewText: We stayed at this hotel for the free parking while we were on vacation out of state. The night before we left: beautiful lobby; carpet in room filthy; old sink attached to wall had no counter space at all and leaked all over the floor when used; cold air blowing in through bottom and side of door because there was no weather stripping so we had to stuff towels to block the air; only 2 vending machines...1 took some of my money without giving me anything; bed was hard; appeared most of the rooms were being remodeled; shuttle to airport was convenient. We spent the night upon our return a week later: stood outside in the cold wind for late shuttle; my hubby accidentally booked this room as standard so it was a smoking room and reaked!; carpet filthy; A/C - heating unit appeared to have not been dusted in at least 9 months; walls with brown/black filth; bathroom wall had a cut out in it with no repair; shower head falling away from tile; toilet seat appeared to have old urine splatter on it; tub so filthy we didn't shower; breakfast juices/milk warm & not on ice; lady rinsed glass after she handled trash without washing her hands. My husband apologized repeatedly for booking here. This is a place you stay when you break down in the middle of the night and have no other hotel options.

review.title: GOOD PLACE TO STAY
review.reviewText: The hotel is very accessible. It is close to the airport, freeway entrance, shopping centers is only an exit away and San Francisco was only a ten minute drive. This is great because the hotels in downtown San Francisco make you pay for parking. So you pay for parking at the hotel and then have to pay for parking at the locations you are visiting. I rather do the ten minute drive, get a free parking spot in front of my room and rest. It was a great place for me to stay since on my vacation I did not only go to San Francisco but other locations in northern California. In the morning they offer you cereal, orange juice, apple juice, coffee, toast, bagels, jam, butter and peanut butter. That would get my family and I started on the road and give us time to find a restaurant when we arrived to our destination. The rooms and bathrooms were clean and seemed like they had been remodeled. I checked in with no problems and checked out with no issues.

review.title: A Very Pleasant Stay
review.reviewText: Despite a lot of negative reviews for this hotel, I must say that they were proven wrong. The hotel staff was very helpful and friendly. The shuttle bus to and from the airport was great! Nice drivers with the exception of one which drove me to the airport on my last day in San Francisco - but I didn't really care, I'm originally from New York after all, I'm used to abrasive attitudes. My room was clean and cozy, towels were replaced everyday. It was enough to just come to sleep at night. My room came with its own heat/AC unit which was very useful during the chilly nights there. The best part was the free breakfast in the mornings. There was bread, mini bagels, cereal, milk, orange juice, apple juice, coffee, tea, butter and cream cheese. It was enough to fill up on to start off my day of exploring. The ladies who set up the breakfast spread were really nice and you should tip them! The only thing about this hotel that can be bothersome is its location. It's far from downtown San Francisco and you will have to figure out the best way to get there. Luckily the SamTrans bus stops right in front of the hotel, which made traveling around much easier. I would stay here again. Especially for the affordable price and great service.

review.title: Services a joke
review.reviewText: This hotel, right off the San Fran airport seems promising and reasonably priced. From the outside, the hotel sure looks nice. The rooms are OK. But don't let that fool you because the services and utilities are a joke. We were there 5 nights and we complained all the way through. First night, after a long road from LA, we wanted to wash up and we only had 2 towels and one facecloth. We also needed extra pillows. We had to ask for all this 3 times because the girl at the front desk could never remember what we needed. In the evening of the second night, we wanted to wash our clothes and take a shower to go out for dinner. But they actually CUT the water supply for the hotel without notifying any of the guests because they were renovating. We had to delay our whole evening. Two hours later, they ran out of toilet paper. My spouse went down to the lobby and actually had to tell them to get some from the store. Third evening, after a night out on the town, we got back to our room and find out that there was no more HOT WATER. AAARGH !! The following morning we were awakened early by the lobby they had misprinted my credit card number. I might run out of space writing about our two other horrible nights so i'll cut to the end. When we finally met the hotel manager, he laughed at us saying that we were having quite an 'adventure'. I told him that actually we were having a nightmare. DO NOT GO THERE unless all the hotels in and around SF are all booked !

review.title: Never Again
review.reviewText: l l rented 2 rooms (Room 1)l was given a key to my room and found that when l entered l was in a room that had luggage, medication and was dirty. l went to the desk and they could not explain why this was but gave me another room, however they directed me to the wrong side of the hotel. The second room l rented we could not access because of lock problems and it took an hour to get into the room. l waited an hour for the shuttle at the airport before taking a taxi to the hotel. l wonder if they have rebranded this hotel because it did not meet the standard of the previous chain

review.title: Lovely place
review.reviewText: This hotel was just gorgeous! Beautifully decorated lobby and breakfast rooms. Our hotel room was spacious, clean and very tastefully decorated. The hotel staff were very helpful and friendly. It is close to the airport yet very quiet considering, and I would definitely stay here again!

review.title: Convenient to the airport-Good enough for the price
review.reviewText: Bummer you have to pay $6.99 for 24 hours of wireless internet. I stayed here 3 times in 2 weeks. The first morning, I got a room where the water would not get hot in the shower. There were 3 of us in a room with only 2 bath towels. I sent my son to the desk to fetch another, and they told him they would deliver one to the room. It took too long, and my teeneage daughter was finished with her shower long before towel arrived(if you have a teenage daughter, you know how long a shower can take, so the hotel had plenty of time). My second stay 2 weeks later, I could not find a place to park except far away in front of the Chinese Restaurant that is attached to the hotel. At midnight, there were other guests outside my door talking very very loudly. I called the desk, and they sent security to hush the people. I slept well. The third night, everything was great; Hot water, quiet, parking. I was also able to get an additional towel at the desk at the time of check-in. This is an inexpensive place to stay with a reliable shuttle to and from the airport. They offer a park-n-fly package. The continental breakfast is a joke, but there is an IHOP across the street, or bring your own fruit and nuts if you like light breakfast. The attached Chinese Buffet is good. It is very silly that the place has a pool in South San Francisco. When would it ever be warm enough to swim there? They should put in a hot tub instead.

review.title: Not a good value for the rate
review.reviewText: Hotel was barely ok and the rate did not justify it. The non smoking rooms still had a lingering smell of smoke. The hotel lobby was presentable but the rooms were not impressive. Continental breakfast comprised of orange juice/coffee, tiny bagels,toast, and cereal.

review.title: Comfortable and affordable
review.reviewText: Friendly staff greeted you in a lovely reception area. The continental breakfast was good and filling.

review.title: If you don't mind the distance from the city it's very good choice
review.reviewText: We stayed with a 18 month daughter. They gave us crib with no additional charge. The room looked renovated, all bathroom was new. There's green garden inside the hotel, swimming pool. We wanted cheap stay out out of the city since we had car. It's 20 minutes with card to the downtown.

review.title: not the nicest place but for the price it was ok
review.reviewText: the room was older style, have been there before when it was run by another chain, it was alot better then. but for the price its ok.

review.title: glad i only stayed one night.....
review.reviewText: it is not that bad.....if your looking for a place close to the airport....and you need to be shuttled.

review.title: GREAT VALUE FOR THE PRICE
review.reviewText: This hotel came up second on my search for lowest priced hotels in the San Francisco Bay Area. I expected a 1-star hotel (dingy, old, bad service) but the lobby was actually nice and classy; rooms were small but the bathrooms were better than I expected. The bathrooms looked remodeled with marble countertops, huge mirrored closet, nice lamp. The hotel also provided clean towels and complimentary toiletries (except no toothpaste). I stayed in overpriced boutique hotels in the city and this was so much better! I will definitely stay here again! Most importantly, free parking! Should I say more?

review.title: horrible service
review.reviewText: i called to the front and asked if wireless internet is free. the lady answered "nope, 6 dollars per day" and cut the line! she didn't even let me to order the service.

review.title: noisy hotel
review.reviewText: There was some kind of party at the hotel the night we stayed. The party ended at the restraunt and seemed moved next door to our room and did not quiet down till around 2 AM. Guess if no one calls to complain, the hotel will not do anything on their own.

review.title: Great Hotel easy access to highway
review.reviewText: It was clean and neat as was the staff. They were helpful and courteous. It had a no frills breakfast, but sufficient. I would stay there again.

review.title: OK
review.reviewText: They are currently remodeling the rooms and are about half finished. The name of the hotel was just changed but still the same owners. The remodeled room are comfortable.

review.title: Good
review.reviewText: good services

review.title: Value for your dollar
review.reviewText: When we arrived several units were under construction and renovations, so the place was a bit dusty and dirty. Not a big problem, but the water was turned off during the renovations, but was later turned back ON when we needed it the most, Night time and in the Morning. Pros: Free Contenntial breakfast, pool (did not use), Cheap stay, Near the airport but did not hear the planes land. Free parking Cons: A 15 min drive from the city to the hotel/motel. Sink not in the washroom, rather near the washroom door (unconventional layout). Car is a must, as food, entertainment and retail shops are a drive away. Conclusion: If you dont mind to drive 15mins to your bed for a cheap nite, then this is the place for you.

review.title: Impressed
review.reviewText: Excellent service, furniture, comfort, breakfest.

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText: It was a very nice and clean hotel all around. The continental breakfast could have been a little bit better but it was overall a nice and pleasant stay.

review.title: Nice place
review.reviewText: we stay here every time we fly out of SF. I have recommended the Goodnite Inn to several people. Nice people at front desk.

review.title: Condition of hotel not the best, beautiful lobby
review.reviewText: For the price, it is okay for park and fly. Beds are not comfortable, they have cut back on their continental breakfast. Was not as satisfied as we were last year.
